ingredients.text: ounces linguica sausage, use the hot rather than the mild, sliced into rounds 1/4 inch thick

ingredients.name: yellow onion
ingredients.text: small yellow onion, chopped kind of finely

ingredients.name: celery
ingredients.text: cup celery, chopped (I use the top leaf and all)

ingredients.name: cilantro
ingredients.text: cup cilantro, chopped (I use stem and leafs)

ingredients.name: chicken broth
ingredients.text: (14 ounce) can chicken broth, low sodium

jsonld.name: Celery, Stilton & Walnut Soup
jsonld.author: Dreamer in Ontario
jsonld.description: This soup sounds so quintessentially English to me with its classic combo of ingredients. Recipe source: Creative Cooking Vegetarian.
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 cups vegetable stock or 2 1/2 cups chicken stock
1 1/2 cups dolcelatte (plus extra to garnish) or 1 1/2 cups gorgonzola, crumbled (plus extra to garnish)
salt & freshly ground black pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large saucepan and saute the shallots, celery and garlic for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly, until softened.
Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 30 seconds.
Gradually stir in the stock and milk, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to a gentle simmer and add the crumbled blue Stilton cheese and walnut halves.
Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in the yogurt and heat for 2 minutes without boiling.
Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a warm soup tureen or individual serving bowls, garnish with chopped celery leaves and extra crumbled blue Stilton cheese, and serve immediately.

review.description: When I first tasted this before the 20-minute simmer, I was worried it would be a one-star throw-out. However, it simmered on. Upon serving it, it went from "ok" to "absolutely outstanding" in about four spoonfulls. (My point being: if the first spoonful doesn't appeal to you, keep eating it at least for a little while). Very delicious, even tho I forgot to put in the yogurt! I have leftovers and will add that to it tomorrow. I used nonfat milk; can't get a boil on that until you put in the full-fat Stilton. So just heated it up well, then put in the Stilton, brought to boil and simmered. It's probably why it looks a little curdled but I don't care as I just cannot justify the fat and cholesterol in anything else besides nonfat milk. The cheese has enough of those both. This would be great served with unsalted, unbuttered popcorn on top as a garnish. Didn't have any, so I just added some saltines. Whatever you do, do not leave out anything else. The celery and walnuts were absolutely essential. When I reheated the leftovers today (one day later), I added in the yogurt. I think I may like it better w/o it, but at the very least, I think it is an optional ingredient. ZWT6
review.author: Debbie R.

ingredients.name: vegetable stock
ingredients.text: cups vegetable stock or 2 1/2 cups chicken stock

ingredients.name: stilton cheese
ingredients.text: cups dolcelatte (plus extra to garnish) or 1 1/2 cups gorgonzola, crumbled (plus extra to garnish)

ingredients.name: salt & ground black pepper
ingredients.text: salt & freshly ground black pepper, to taste

jsonld.name: Caramel Nut Wedges
jsonld.author: JanetB-KY
jsonld.description: I haven't tried these yet; I found the recipe in an old issue of Womans Day and thought it sounded really good and pretty darn easy, so figured I would share it. Cooking time includes chilling time
recipeIngredient: 1 refrigerated ready to bake 9 inch pie shell

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 450 degrees; line a 9 inch round cake pan w/ foil, letting ends extend about 2in.
above pan.
Unfold pie crust into pan; press into pan, folding edges down slightly to make a 1 inch high lip; press edges gently with a fork, then prick crust all over with a fork.
Press a sheet of foil snugly onto crust and bake for 12 minutes; remove foil and bake for 6 minutes more until lightly browned; remove from oven and set aside;.
reduce oven heat to 350 degrees.
Whisk ice cream topping, eggs, butter and vanilla in a medium bowl until well blended; pour into crust; scatter nuts evenly across top of filling.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes until puffed, lightly browned and a knife inserted near center comes out clean.
Remove to a wire rack to cool; refrigerate at least fours hours to firm; when firm lift foil by edges to rack to cut; cut into 24 wedges.

review.description: Made for spring PAC 2008, these were very good... mine came out sort of like a pecan pie, not exactly as I was picturing but tasty nonetheless! Good salty and sweet treat!
review.author: vitalev

ingredients.name: pie shell
ingredients.text: refrigerated ready to bake 9 inch pie shell

jsonld.name: Caribbean Lime Coolers (Cookie Mix)
jsonld.author: lemoncurd
jsonld.description: Make and share this Caribbean Lime Coolers (Cookie Mix) recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 (17 1/2 ounce) box betty crocker sugar cookie mix (1 lb 1.5 oz)
6 tablespoons butter or 6 tablespoons margarine, melted

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F.
In large bowl, stir cookie mix, coconut, lime peel, lime juice, butter and egg until soft dough forms.
Drop dough by level tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake 9 to 13 minutes or until edges are light golden brown. Cool 1 minute; remove from cookie sheet.
Cool completely.
With a small strainer, sift powdered sugar over cooled cookies.
Store covered at room temperature.

review.description: This are wonderful for someone who likes lime or lemon flavored cookies. I really don't think they need the powdered sugar on top however and I omit that.
review.author: Shirlsaw

ingredients.name: sugar cookie mix
ingredients.text: (17 1/2 ounce) box betty crocker sugar cookie mix (1 lb 1.5 oz)

ingredients.name: butter
ingredients.text: tablespoons butter or 6 tablespoons margarine, melted

jsonld.name: Cheap Beef Stroganoff
jsonld.author: MommaEllen
jsonld.description: In my never-ending quest to fill up my family cheaply, I borrowed this recipe from a friend and made it my own.We use rotini noodles, but often change to a different shaped noodle just to make supper more interesting. I serve the meat mixture over the noodles to make this go farther. You can also use turkey burger instead of the beef hamburger.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the noodles following the package directions and drain.
Saute the onions slightly, add hamburger and cook thoroughly.
Drain the hamburger.
Add the soup, garlic powder,salt and pepper and heat thoroughly on low heat.
Fold in sour cream and optional peas and heat for another 5 minutes.
Serve over pasta noodles and enjoy!

review.description: This was a very easy quick-fix supper. Like another reviewer I used canned mushrooms instead of peas, and like you, I served the stroganoff over rotini pasta. Thanks for a nice simple supper. Made for PAC Fall 2009.
review.author: Debs Recipes

jsonld.name: Cheddar-Stuffed Celery
jsonld.author: Bergy
jsonld.description: I can't believe that there isn't a recipe like this already posted but I searched 7 pages and could not find one. It is simple and tasty. Lovely on an appetizer tray or on your salad plate. I like to use McLaren's Imperial but any nice nippy cheddar will do. I use Lite Mayo

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the mayo & cheddar together to make a spreadable paste.
Fill the stalks.
Cut into serving size pieces.
Sprinkle with paprika or leave plain & serve.

review.description: This is a go to appetizer I learned from my mother-in-law more than 20 years ago but our recipe steps it up a notch. We zest a bit of juice from an onion and add a few splashes of worchestershire sauce. You could use onion powder instead but I find using a zester on onion until you get about a tsp of juice tastes best. The plate is always empty at the end of the party and its equally popular with kids and adults. Also, this is a great snack if your going low carb for a few days.
review.author: Colleen W.

jsonld.name: Cheeseburger Quiche
jsonld.author: flower7
jsonld.description: All of the other recipes here for Cheeseburger Quiche were low-carb, crustless versions, which was not what I was after, since I had a pie crust to use. After some googling, I found a few recipes which I combined to make this one. Serve with your favorite burger toppings if desired!
recipeIngredient: 6 ounces sharp cheddar cheese, shredded, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a skillet, brown ground beef and onion; drain and set aside.
In a bowl, beat the eggs, then whisk in the mayo, milk, flour, oregano, salt and pepper.
Stir in beef mixture and 1 cup cheese.
Pour mixture into pie shell.
Bake for 40-45 minutes until eggs are firm. Remove from oven and sprinkle with remaining cheese. Allow to stand for 5 minutes before cutting.

review.description:
I use Bisquick. Same results. You can also add a few extra fillings if you wish to give it more texture. I have added olives, green and red bell peppers, peas and carrots, hash browns etc.
All good.
review.author: GEEMAN

ingredients.name: cheddar
ingredients.text: ounces sharp cheddar cheese, shredded, divided

jsonld.name: Charlotte Russe
jsonld.author: josephinewillis
jsonld.description: A traditional Christmas dessert at our house. Very rich but light - the perfect ending to a big meal. You can make it with any variation (change the cookie and the extract) but the "traditional" one is listed below. (And the lady fingers should be the fluffy soft kind - not the hard Italian ones.)

recipeInstructions.text: Find a pretty glass serving dish and line the bottom and sides with ladyfingers (halfs).
Warm the milk to about 98 degrees and set aside. (It should be blood warm, not hot.).
Beat the egg whites until frothy.
In a separate bowl, whip the cream until thick but not stiff.
Fold in the sugar.
Fold in the vanilla.
Fold in the egg whites.
In the meantime, dissolve the gelatin into the warmed milk. Working quickly, strain the milk/gelatin mixture into the bowl containing the cream/sugar/egg white mixture.
Pour the mixture into the bowl lined with ladyfingers, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours.

review.description: I really should cool down before posting, but..... I attempted this for Easter 2017. As a matter of fact, it's chilling in the fridge and Easter is two days away. I have already driven the 1 1/2 hours to our food store for the week-- so there is no turning back...... 3.5 oz of gelatin????? I use gelatin all of the time and have never used this quantity to set something. That was like 3/4 cup!!!! I should have known. AND that amount wouldn't dissolve in 1/2 cup milk. My Vita-Mix couldn't even grind it all up. I wasted like 1/2+ cup of grass-fed gelatin (actually I did keep and and will remelt for MANY other recipes. It just infuriates me that this was so poorly written, AND that I got taken. I sinerely hope that enough gelatin was incorporated to set this so that my homemade lady finger aren't wreaked too.
review.author: RealFoodie2

jsonld.name: Cheddar and Mango Chutney Sandwich
jsonld.author: loveleesmile
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cheddar and Mango Chutney Sandwich recipe from Food.com.

recipeInstructions.text: Not like they are really needed but, take two thick slices of bread, a tablespoon of softened butter and the filling combo. Spread butter on one side of both slices of bread, lay the bread on a work surface, butter-side down, and put the fillings inside.
Place sandwich in an already hot nonstick pan (or several, if you are making more sandwiches) on medium heat.
Cook 5 minutes, flip, then cook 2 more minutes. Cut sandwich in half and eat.

review.description: This is a great combo! I used homemade rhubarb chutney (recipe #300651) and 12-grain bread instead of pumpernickel. Thanks for sharing!
review.author: flower7

jsonld.name: Cheese Danish Pie Crust Squares
jsonld.author: Emily Elizabeth
jsonld.description: My mom used to make cinnamon rolls with pie crust scraps, which gave me the idea for making these danishes. It is a great way to use leftover dough and enjoy the taste of a cheese danish without having to make a whole batch. These danishes are a wonderful treat to have with your coffee in the morning! I make them with my gluten free pie crust recipe (Recipe #266631), so I do not know how they would taste on a regular wheat flour crust, but I'm sure they would still be tasty! I like to make half the batch with chocolate chips and the other half with raspberry jam (put this on top of the cream cheese mixture before baking). I had trouble naming this one, so I would love to hear ideas for a tasty and descriptive name!

recipeInstructions.text: Roll out your extra pie crust about 1/4 inch thick and cut into 6 squares. Take the scrap dough from that and shape into a 7th square (this one won't look as nice, but will be just as tasty!). Press down in the middle of your squares to make a small circular indention.

In a small bowl mix cream cheese and powdered sugar together with a fork until it has the consistancy of icing. Scoop a small amount in the center of each square (about 1/2-1 tsp). Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees (you can put it right in with your pie).
Let cool for a few minutes, then pop a chocolate chip in the center of the gooey cream cheese. Sprinkle powdered sugar on top for the final touch.

review.description: Made this with gluten-free ingredients. Pretty darn tasty! : )
review.author: GinnyP

jsonld.name: Cheese-Crusted Flat Bread
jsonld.author: SharleneW
jsonld.description: Try this wonderful alternative to garlic bread with your next spaghetti dinner. It is similar to cheese focaccia. The recipe is from Pillsbury's Best of the Bake-Off Cookbook. Just recently I made it using the Chipotle-Herb Butter from recipe #63245 and it was awesome too. Lots of possiblities if you use your imagination.
recipeIngredient: 1 (1/4 ounce) package active dry yeast or 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast

recipeInstructions.text: In large bowl, combine 2 cups flour, sugar, salt and yeast; mix well.
In 2-cup glass measuring cup, combine milk, water and 2 tablespoons butter.
Microwave just until water is very warm (120 to 130°F) (not much more than a minute should do it).
Add warm liquid to flour mixture; mix well.
Stir in remaining 1/2 to 1 cup flour to form a stiff dough.
On lightly floured surface, knead dough until smooth, about 5 minutes.
Place dough in greased bowl and cover loosely with greased plastic wrap and put a cloth towel over that.
Let rise in a warm place until light and doubled in size, 45 to 60 minutes.
Grease two 9-inch round cake or pie pans.
Divide dough in half; pressing each half in greased pan.
In a small bowl, combine topping ingredients, mixing well.
Spread mixture over dough.
Prick tops generously with a fork.
Sprinkle evenly with cheese.
Cover again as above and let rise in a warm place until light and doubled in size, 30 to 45 minutes.
Heat oven to 375°F Uncover dough and bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm.

review.description: AWESOME bread that goes great with soup or stew! The amount of salt for the bread dough is not listed, so I used 1/2 teaspoon. The topping is really yummy. I tweaked the seasoning amounts and used a mix of mozzarella and cheddar cheeses. Next time DH would like me to include sliced jalapenos with the melted cheeses. Another reviewer suggests dipping the bread in pizza sauce. What a great idea! With lots of room for creativity, I can tell already that I'll be making this recipe often. Thanks so much for sharing it!
review.author: Debs Recipes

ingredients.text: (1/4 ounce) package active dry yeast or 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast

jsonld.name: Carrot Lentil Casserole
jsonld.author: TexasToast R
jsonld.description: Very easy, healthy, frugal and most important, delicious! This recipe comes from "Everyday Light Meals" from Taste of Home. It is also good topped with a dollop of sour cream and some salsa.

recipeInstructions.text: In a 3 quart baking dish coated with nonstick cooking spray, combine the onion, carrots, lentils, rice, cheese, green pepper and seasonings. Stir in broth and tomatoes.
Cover tightly with foil and bake at 350°F for 1-1/4 to 1-3/4 hours or until the liquid is absorbed and lentils and rice are tender.

review.description: I really enjoyed this recipe - SO simple, but flavorful and filling. It smelled so wonderful when it was cooking, it brought my neighbor over! (When I told him what was in it, he turned it down. What did he expect?!? A cheeseburger??!) I also love that I was able to make this recipe for about $5.00 - always a plus! Thanks, TexasToaster, for another great recipe. PAC Fall 2009.
review.author: AnnieLynne

jsonld.name: Cheddar Cheese Puffs
jsonld.author: Dancer
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cheddar Cheese Puffs recipe from Food.com.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, boil the butter and water until butter melts.
Remove from heat, stir in flour, cheeses, paprika and mustard.
Return to heat and cook 2-3 minutes, heating constantly to form a paste.
Remove from heat.
In a small bowl, whisk the egg.
Slowly stir into mixture and beat until thoroughly comined.
Spoon 20 to 25 coin sized mounds of mixture onto lighlty greased baking sheet.
Sprinkle with a selection of deiiferent toppings.
Bake in pre-heated (400F/200C) oven for 15 to 20 minutes until crisp and golden.
Serves hot or cold.

review.description: Damn, those are good! My little girls asked for more; only pancakes are so honored!
review.author: Galadare

jsonld.name: Cheesy Broccoli Bacon Casserole
jsonld.author: Marie
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cheesy Broccoli Bacon Casserole recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 2 slices bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled

recipeInstructions.text: Make a white sauce with butter, flour, milk and salt and pepper.
When thickened, add cheese and stir until melted.
Pour sauce over cooked broccoli in 9" baking dish.
Top with almonds, bacon and buttered crumbs.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until bubbly.

review.description: I rate with no stars since I missed a key step. Did not see to cook the broccoli first. So, it was quite crunchy. The flavor was good, but texture was way off. I believe if made correctly would turn out wonderfully.
review.author: Vicki in CT

ingredients.name: bacon
ingredients.text: slices bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled

jsonld.name: Castroville Special
jsonld.author: Toni in Colorado
jsonld.description: This is a sandwich recipe that I got from "365 Ways to Cook Vegetarian". Be sure to use a crusty type roll. Use a sweet onion.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Drain artichoke hearts over a small bowl, reserving marinade.
Coarsley chop artichokes.
With a spoon, spread some marinade on the bottom half of a crusty roll.
Place equal amounts of chopped artichoke hearts, tomatoes, onion, mushrooms and cheese inside each roll.
Wrap each sandwich in foil.
Bake until cheese melts and sandwich is heated through, 10-15 minutes.

review.description: I scaled this recipe down to one sandwich. The only change I made was to add some salt and black pepper. This is a very good and light sandwich. Made for Adopt a Veggie Tag. Thanks Toni in Colorado for posting.
review.author: sloe cooker

jsonld.name: Cheesecake Squares (Crustless)
jsonld.author: DogAndCatDoc
jsonld.description: I like the fact that these do not have a crust. They are very rich and so you should cut them into very small squares.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In bowl beat cream cheese and sugar together until smooth.
Add eggs, yogurt, vanilla, lemon juice and Bisquick mix.
Mix just until smooth.
Pour into greased 9 inch square baking dish.
Bake 25-30 minutes, just until center is set.
In bowl, combine sour cream, sugar and vanilla until smooth.
Carefully spread over cheesecake.
Bake 4 minutes.
Cool on wire rack for one hour.
Refrigerate until chilled.
Cut into small squares.
May garnish with fresh fruit or cherry pie filling if desired.
(I like it plain).

review.description: Yummy! This was too easy! I was in the mood for cheesecake but didnt have anything to use for a crust. Well, I saw your recipe and made it. I wish I had had my digital camera to take a pic. It looked awesome! (My friend is borrowing it..) Thanks for an easy, repeat recipe!:)
review.author: Ang11002

jsonld.name: Cheesy Baked Egg and Bacon Benedict
jsonld.author: Kittencalrecipezazz
jsonld.description: This takes no time at all to make, and makes a great weekend brunch! Serve this over toated English muffin halves, it's delicious! For this recipe use the thin-sliced bacon (uncooked) you can use the thicker sliced but you will have to partailly cook it first before using in this dish..
jsonld.keywords: Pork,Meat,Very Low Carbs,Kid Friendly,Christmas,Brunch,< 30 Mins,Oven,Beginner Cook,Easy
recipeIngredient: 15 slices thin bacon (can use more or less)
1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese (can use less)

recipeInstructions.text: Set oven to 400 degrees (oven rack set to bottom position).
Lightly grease a 13 x 9-inch baking dish.
Place the uncooked thin bacon slices evenly into the bottom of the baking dish.
Sprinkle the Swiss cheese on top of the bacon.
Break the eggs over the cheese (spacing evenly).
Pour the whipping cream over the eggs, then sprinkle with salt and black pepper.
Bake at 424 degrees (bottom oven rack) for 10 minutes.
Remove from oven then sprinkle with parmesan cheese then paprika; return to oven for another 8-10 minutes or until set.
Let stand for about 10 minutes before serving.

review.description: I divided this in thirds to make. The first casserole I made as directed using 5 slices bacon, 4 eggs 1/3 cup cream, 2/3 cup swiss and about 1/8 cup parm cheese in a 8x8 pan, and served it over english muffins, DS and DD#1 loved it and both thought it did resemble eggs benedict. It is very rich and filling. I am not a lover of eggs with yolks I can see, (I know Im wierd) so I made another 8x8 casserole with 5 slices bacon, 2/3 cup swiss, 4 eggs, slightly beaten, 1/3 cup cream over the top and the parm. This was good and rich also. DS liked them both. I would like to try it with a thin canadian bacon or ham. Wither way this is a great casserole and very quick to put together. This smaller casseroles did not take the full 10 minutes at 425, more like 8 minutes. Thanks Kitten!

itemReviewed.name: Cheesy Baked Egg and Bacon Benedict

review.author: LAURIE

ingredients.name: bacon
ingredients.text: slices thin bacon (can use more or less)

ingredients.name: parmesan cheese
ingredients.text: cup grated parmesan cheese (can use less)

jsonld.name: Cheddar Potato Bake
jsonld.author: bmcnichol
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cheddar Potato Bake recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can Campbell's cheddar cheese soup

recipeInstructions.text: Mix potatoes, soup, sour cream, and pepper.
Put in 1 1/2-qt. baking dish.
BAKE at 350°F for 30 minute or until hot.

review.description: Simple to make & OH SO TASTY! We really enjoyed this combo of potato & cheese, & as much as I was tempted to add more cheese, I didn't & was completely satisfied with the recipe as written! Many thanks for posting it! [Tagged & made in Please Review My Recipe]
review.author: Sydney Mike

ingredients.name: cheddar
ingredients.text: (10 3/4 ounce) can Campbell's cheddar cheese soup

jsonld.name: Cheese and Spinach Rice
jsonld.author: cba533
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cheese and Spinach Rice recipe from Food.com.

recipeInstructions.text: In a 3-quart saucepan, bring the water, bouillon cubes, and spinach to a boil.
Add the rice to the saucepan. Lower the heat to a simmer and cover the pot. Cook for as long as the rice package instuctions state.
Take the pot off the heat. Let it sit, covered, for 5 minutes.
Stir the rice and spinach with a wooden spoon. Add the cheese. Stir until the cheese melts and the mixture is well blended.
Serve immediately.

review.description: good uesed swiss cheese added a chopped mushroom
review.author: blonder

jsonld.name: Cheesy Chicken Breast
jsonld.author: Expat in Holland
jsonld.description: This dish is an easy and great way to serve boneless chicken breast that will please the family. Kids really love this. A quick and easy dish for a midweek meal.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl combine oil and garlic and let set for 15minutes.
In a bowl combine breadcrumbs, pepper, salt and paprika. Stir well.
Add parmesan cheese, cheddar cheese and parsley to the breadcrumb mixture and stir well to combine.
Dip chicken breast into oil to coat on both sides, then dip into crumb mixture coating well on both sides. Place chicken breast on greased baking dish.
Repeat with all chicken breasts.
Drizzle remaining oil over chicken breasts.
Bake at 400° for 35 minutes.
Remove from oven and let rest 5 minutes before serving.

review.description: This is so delicious! I added 3 garlic gloves cause my husband and my brother in law love garlic.And there were no left overs :( ( I thought there would be so I could have some next day for lunch) And I was told that we are gonna have that more often for supper.A big thumb up!
review.author: crysmac

jsonld.name: Cheesy Greens and Rice Gratin
jsonld.author: FLKeysJen
jsonld.description: Tasty side dish or vegetarian entree, adapted from 'Eat Your Vegetables'. There are several recipes on Food.com for the Za'atar spice mix, or you can purchase it at spice shops (I bought it at www.savoryspiceshop.com).
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup crushed tomatoes (in their liquid) or 4 chopped plum tomatoes
4 tablespoons roasted pistachios, shelled and chopped
4 cups collard greens or 4 cups chard leaves
1/2 cup grated gruyere or 1/2 cup other good melting cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven broiler, and adjust the rack to be several inches from the flame.

Pour the olive oil into a small cast iron or other ovenproof skillet over medium heat. When it shimmers, add the garlic and cook until it starts to become tender. Sprinkle in the za'atar and cook for just a few seconds, letting the spices bubble and bloom. Add in the greens and cook until wilted, then stir in the tomatoes and rice, taste, and add salt as needed. Cook for a few minutes to let the flavors combine, then turn off the heat. Stir in the pistachios.

Pack the rice mixture down evenly with a spatula. Sprinkle with the cheese. Slide the skillet under the broiler and cook 3 or 4 minutes - until the cheese is melted, bubbly, and slightly browned. Let cool slightly, but eat it hot.

review.description: This is so tasty for being so quick with so few ingredients! I used less oil and the whole can of tomatoes. I thought a whole tablespoon of za'atar might be a lot, but it was perfect, and the dish had lots of flavor. Two of us ate this as an entrée, and it was satisfying - but I could see it feeding at least twice as many people as a side dish with grilled chicken or fish.
review.author: Maito

ingredients.name: crushed tomato
ingredients.text: cup crushed tomatoes (in their liquid) or 4 chopped plum tomatoes

ingredients.name: roasted pistachio
ingredients.text: tablespoons roasted pistachios, shelled and chopped

ingredients.name: kale
ingredients.text: cups collard greens or 4 cups chard leaves

ingredients.name: gruyere
ingredients.text: cup grated gruyere or 1/2 cup other good melting cheese

jsonld.name: Cheesy Spaghetti
jsonld.author: Kimberley Quinlan
jsonld.description: A kid favorite and a parent's favorite because it is so easy. When you want to go out, make this and the kids won't even know you are gone. I use medium cheddar but you can add different cheeses to this recipe. It was my favorite as a kid. Very cheesy and fun! This recipe is good by itself.
jsonld.keywords: Spaghetti,Toddler Friendly,Kid Friendly,Kosher,High In...,Beginner Cook,< 4 Hours,Easy,Inexpensive

recipeInstructions.text: Dice cheddar cheese into small cubes.
Put diced cheese in an ovenproof bowl.
Add 1 can diced tomatoes, Spaghetti Sauce, salt and pepper if desired.
Partially cook 4 to 6 portions of spaghetti.
Drain.
Add spaghetti to bowl.
Mix all together (I use my hands).
Bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees until golden crispy and gooey.

review.description: We really liked this! I think it is important to choose a good spaghetti sauce since you can taste it so much.
review.author: WW Girl

jsonld.name: Cheese Squares
jsonld.author: Mimi in Maine
jsonld.description: These are like little cheesecake squares with a crumbly topping. I have been making these for a good many years and we all love them. This is for an 8" square pan. If you want a 9"x13" pan, you will have to double the recipe.

recipeInstructions.text: TOPPING:.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl and mix to crumbly; reserve 1 cup for the top.
Press the rest into and 8" square pan and bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes.
CHEESE BATTER:.
With an electric mixer, blend the sugar and cream cheese till smooth.
Add the egg, milk, lemon juice, and vanilla.
Beat well.
Spread over the baked crust.
Sprinkle with the remaining cup of crumb.
Bake at 350 degres for 25 minutes.
Cut when cool.

review.description: These cheese squares were sensational! Extremely easy to make and even easier to eat!! I used low-fat cream cheese and skim milk. Thanks for a great one!!
review.author: BamaBelle30

jsonld.name: Cheese Pancakes -- Nigella Lawson
jsonld.author: milliwuu
jsonld.description:
Cheesecakelets Recipe courtesy Nigella Lawson. 
Show: Nigella Feasts. 
Episode: Breakfast All Hours

recipeInstructions.text: Put the strawberries into a bowl and sprinkle with balsamic vinegar and sugar. Stir before covering with plastic wrap and leaving to steep while you make the cheesecakelets.

Mix the egg yolks with the sugar, beating well. Add the vanilla, cottage cheese, and flour. Then, in another bowl, whisk the whites until frothy with a hand whisk and fold into the cottage cheese mixture.

Heat a smooth griddle or nonstick skillet and dollop the batter onto it make cakelets of about 3 to 4 inches in diameter. Each cheesecakelet will take a minute or so to firm up underneath, then you should flip it and cook the other side, and remove to a warmed plate when ready.
Turn the strawberries in the ruby syrup they've made and squish some pieces with a fork at the same time. Serve with the hot cheesecakelets.

review.description: This was a good and fairly quick recipe to make. I have repeated it with blueberries and honey as a topping with fair results.
review.author: JenPo

jsonld.name: Cheesy Corn Squares
jsonld.author: Kizzikate
jsonld.description: This can be either a side dish, or cut smaller squares to serve as an appetizer. From Taste of Home, 2001 Annual Recipes.
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 1/4 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine first 7 ingredients. Stir in eggs, corn, ricotta, onion, Parmesan. oil, and 4 oz. mozzarella; mix well.
Pour into a greased 13x9 baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella, and paprika.
Bake, uncovered, at 350, for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into squares.

review.description: This was super yummy! :) A great comfort food. My 13 yo DD made it by herself (Dad just had to show her what ricotta and parm-reggiano was!) I used a no salt added can of creamed corn (instead of kernel corn, by accident), 1 1/2 C of mozzarella and whole wheat flour. It was so moist and everyone loved it. Definitely a keeper. Ours did not come out as brown as the picture.
review.author: WI Cheesehead

ingredients.name: whole kernel corn
ingredients.text: (15 1/4 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained

jsonld.name: Chele D's Shrimp Creole
jsonld.author: Chele B
jsonld.description: I found several recipes on Zaar for Shrimp Creole, but none of them was what I was looking for. I just came up with my own twist and it was inhaled by all--even the kids.
recipeIngredient: 1 lb shrimp (shelled, deveined tails removed, any size you like)
3 garlic cloves, minced (or I like a fine grater or microplane or press)
3 dashes hot sauce (adjust to your heat level)
1 vegetable bouillon (I use Knorr and it makes 2c of broth, check your package and use 2 if yours only makes 1 cup)

recipeInstructions.text: In a deep skillet or dutch oven, Brown onion and bell pepper in bacon grease over med head for about 10 minutes.
add garlic and saute another couple of minutes, you don't want to brown the garlic.
add everything else to the pan, except for the shrimp.
Simmer for 30 minutes or so, until flavors meld.
Add shrimp and simmer for about 10 more minutes or until shrimp are cooked through.
Serve over rice.

review.description: This was outstanding! My DB thought he had died and went to heaven! Would not let me share any leftovers with neighbors as he wants to eat it again tomorrow...that is a big compliment...Made for PAC Fall 2009
review.author: CIndytc

ingredients.name: shrimp
ingredients.text: lb shrimp (shelled, deveined tails removed, any size you like)

ingredients.name: garlic clove
ingredients.text: garlic cloves, minced (or I like a fine grater or microplane or press)

ingredients.name: hot sauce
ingredients.text: dashes hot sauce (adjust to your heat level)

ingredients.name: vegetable bouillon
ingredients.text: vegetable bouillon (I use Knorr and it makes 2c of broth, check your package and use 2 if yours only makes 1 cup)

jsonld.name: Cheesy Pasta Bake
jsonld.author: Mamas Kitchen Hope
jsonld.description: Just as fast as a boxed mix but much healthier and yummier! Very popular here in TX where we like to add a little crushed red pepper or cayenne to it. Very Italian in flavor.
recipeIngredient: 1 lb ground turkey, cooked and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Mix sauce, meat, parmesan, mushrooms and pasta in a greased or sprayed 9x13 pan.
Top with mozzarella and bake at 375F for 30 minutes.

review.description: Made this tonight mama! Don't know how i missed this during the world tour earlier. I used leftover spaghetti and meat sauce and pasta. This was perfect to make after being at the Dr's office all day. Thanks Mama for something easy!
review.author: Jessica K

ingredients.text: lb ground turkey, cooked and drained

jsonld.name: Cheesy Ranch Potato Bake
jsonld.author: Krystal McDow
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cheesy Ranch Potato Bake recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 4 lbs russet potatoes, cut into 1/4 inch cubes
1 (8 ounce) package shredded colby-monterey jack cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Place the potatoes in the baking dish. Season with chili powder, salt, and pepper. Evenly distribute the butter over the potatoes.

Cover dish with aluminum foil, and bake 1 hour in the preheated oven, until potatoes are tender. Remove from oven, and mix in the cheese and Ranch dressing. Continue cooking 10 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

review.description: This was a very yummy side dish to go with our ribs. Pretty easy to put together, but it does take some time to get all those potatoes cut up, even if you're not peeling them.
review.author: berry271

ingredients.name: russet potato
ingredients.text: lbs russet potatoes, cut into 1/4 inch cubes

ingredients.name: colby-monterey jack cheese
ingredients.text: (8 ounce) package shredded colby-monterey jack cheese

jsonld.name: Cheesy Lemon Butter
jsonld.author: kzbhansen
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cheesy Lemon Butter recipe from Food.com.

recipeInstructions.text: In heavy pan mix eggs, juice, butter, sugar and salt. Bring to a boil while stirring over low heat, then cook for 3 minutes more.
Remove from heat and cool.
Beat Cream Cheese and lemon peel.
When egg mixture is cool, blend into the cream cheese until smooth.
Store in the fridge.

review.description: I think this needs more than 5 stars. I have never made a flavoured butter. I now know I need to make more. This is great I tried it on piece of toast. I will be making scones to try it on. This is great! Thanks for posting.
review.author: barefootmommawv

jsonld.name: Chef Bob's Chocolate Oatmeal Cookies
jsonld.author: mailbelle
jsonld.description: No-bake chocolate oatmeal cookies with peanut butter. Chef Bob is an executive chef and a regular guest chef on our local Fox affiliate. These cookies were recently featured on "Good Day Alabama."

recipeInstructions.text: Bring milk, shortening, cocoa, and sugar to a boil for 2-3 minutes - melting the sugar.
Add peanut butter and vanilla. Stir and add oats.
Stir again then drop by spoonfuls on wax paper. Allow to cool and set.

review.description: What a nice blend of flavors for a no-bake cookie. I was having a tremendous craving for chocolate the other night and threw 1/2 of a recipe together in no time at all. I did use dark cocoa for this recipe (as that is all I had) so they were a bit richer than probably using a different cocoa but very tasty! A half recipe gave me 44 cookies so beware that this recipe gives tons of cookies! They store and save well - it is day 3 and they are still fresh and moist which will be wonderful when I make them for school lunches again this fall. Thanks for sharing a keeper! Made for me and tagged in Bargain Basement tag game.
review.author: HokiesMom

jsonld.name: Cherry Vanilla Thrilla'
jsonld.author: BeccaB3c
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cherry Vanilla Thrilla' recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup cherry vanilla diet Dr. Pepper soda
1 ounce torani sugar-free black cherry syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Pour ingredients into a shaker.
Shake.
Pour.
Garnish with a Maraschino Cherry.

review.description: Yum Yum! This was a great drink and a definite change from my regular stolli vanilla and coke combination. Thanks!
review.author: Pepper Monkey

ingredients.name: diet dr. pepper soda
ingredients.text: cup cherry vanilla diet Dr. Pepper soda

ingredients.name: black cherry syrup
ingredients.text: ounce torani sugar-free black cherry syrup

jsonld.name: Cherry Angel
jsonld.author: penny wallin
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cherry Angel recipe from Food.com.

recipeInstructions.text: In a mixing bowl, fix pudding as directed on packages.
Mix with mixer on medium speed till slightly thicken, add sour cream, mix well.
Set aside.
Cut up cake in 1 1/2 cubes.
In large bowl layer cake, pudding, and cherry pie filling.
Refrigerate over night.

review.description: This rates a five star easily. What a simple way to make a complicated truffle easy!! Different toppings would go easily with this as well. Next time I'll make the adult version with a bit of rum added to the pudding so it too can soak into the cake. Thanks for this simple and delicious dessert.
review.author: Tebo3759

jsonld.name: Cherry Date Skillet Cookies
jsonld.author: RobertGoodman
jsonld.description: This wows them every time! From Land O Lakes: Snowy coconut coats these made-in-the-skillet buttery date cookies. They are ready in just a short time.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in 10-inch skillet; stir in brown sugar and dates. Remove from heat. Stir in egg; return to heat. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a full boil (4 to 6 minutes). Boil, stirring constantly, 1 minute.
Remove from heat; stir in 1 cup coconut and all remaining ingredients until moistened. Let stand 10 minutes.
Shape rounded teaspoonfuls into 1-inch balls; roll in remaining coconut.

review.description: Made this recipe (along with some others) as part of a cookie give-away some of us are having in our mobile home park today & they are very nice tasting little buggers! I think I actually like them better cold from the frig, but however they're eaten, that combo of date & cherry & coconut is very nice! Thanks for posting the recipe! [Made & reviewed in New Kids on the Block tag]
review.author: Sydney Mike

jsonld.name: Chicago Chicken Casserole
jsonld.author: dojemi
jsonld.description: This is a terrific recipe to make when you have left over chicken. Saves a step, cuts down on the prep time and uses up that chicken.

recipeInstructions.text: Poach chicken in water, when cool enough to handle pull apart into bite-size pieces.
In a large 9x12 casserole layer cooked chicken, drained corn and broccoli.
Mix soup with milk, cheese, mushrooms and pimentos.
Heat and pour over chicken.
Sprinkle top with Ritz crackers which have been mixed with enough butter to moisten.
If prepared ahead and refrigerate, do not top with the Ritz until ready to bake.
Bake for 1 hour or till bubbly and hot.
Do not fill casserole to full; this cooks over easily.

review.description: I saw this posted and decided to make it tonight. We both loved the flavor. There is a lot of sauce so I wanted some rice to go with it. Easy recipe. Next time I will keep it in mind when we have leftover rotisserie chicken.
review.author: Mysterygirl

jsonld.name: Chicken & Rice for Two
jsonld.author: Robert Byrd
jsonld.description: This is my Mother's chicken & rice recipe, with slight modifications by me. I've always liked it, and thought it would be nice to pass along

recipeInstructions.text: Pour 2 cups instant rice, 2 cups water, the butter and the salt into a microwave safe container.
Cook on high for 7-8 minutes.
Fluff with fork when done.
In a small roasting pan, grease, oil or butter the sides, then empty the rice into the pan and level it out.
In a mixing bowl, empty the can of soup, 1/2 can of water and stir until smooth.
Add the instant onion soup mix and stir until all the ingredients have been incorporated into the mix.
Pour about 2/3 of the soup mix over the rice.
Put the chicken on top of the rice, and pour the rest of the soup mix over the chicken.
Cover the pan, and cook in a 400 F.
oven for 3/4 of an hour.
Remove cover, and cook for an additional 10 minutes.

review.description: I used 4 breasts instead of the legs, and just put everything in the dish and popped into the oven. There were NO leftovers.
review.author: Lali8752

jsonld.name: Chicken 65 or 'hot and Spicy Chicken'!
jsonld.author: Charishma_Ramchanda
jsonld.description: This recipe is posted by request. I found it on www.khanakhazana.com. It was submitted by Madhavi from NJ, USA. This famous dish from Andhra region goes great with rice and sambar. Also a favorite companion on drink parties. To reduce heat in the recipe just substitute half of chili powder with shimla mirch powder.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix corn flour, all purpose flour, egg, ginger garlic paste, chili powder and salt to thick batter.
Add water if required.
Add chicken pieces to the batter and marinate for an hour.
Deep fry the marinated chicken pieces till they turn golden.
Heat 4 tsp oil in a sauce pan and add slit chillies, yogurt, garam masala, red color, little salt and the fried chicken pieces.
Fry for 4-5 minutes and remove from heat.
Add lime juice, mix well and garnish with onions.

review.description:
Don't mix the ketchup, hot sauce or anything with acid into the burger mixture! The meat will become mealy and crumbly due to the acid in the sauces. It denatures the meat or cooks it.
Ever see a buffalo chicken burger in the market? That's what I thought....there is a reason. Put the condiments on the burger after it is cooked.
review.author: Skylar S.

jsonld.name: Chesapeake Clam Chowder
jsonld.author: Bev I Am
jsonld.description: Make and share this Chesapeake Clam Chowder recipe from Food.com.

recipeInstructions.text: Boil water and add potatoes and onion.
Cook until tender.
Add bacon drippings, salt and sugar and pepper.
Cut up clams and add.
Cook 10 minutes.
Slowly pour in milk and stir until soup begins to thicken.

review.description: This has terrific flavor with a nice hint of sweetness. It's super easy to prepare, too. The only thing was that I think 1 1/2 quarts of water was too much. It made it to "watery." I would certainly make this again, but only use 1 quart of water (or maybe just double the potatoes and clams). Everything is else is terrific just as written! Thanx for a great new clam chowder!
review.author: Parsley

jsonld.name: Chewy Chocolate Weetbix Slice
jsonld.author: Angel-mae cleopatr
jsonld.description:
Very yummy slightly addictive slice you would never guess that its made from weetbix
recipe was given to my mum by a friend of hers
jsonld.keywords: Cookie & Brownie,Australian,Kid Friendly,< 30 Mins,For Large Groups,Beginner Cook,Easy,Inexpensive

recipeInstructions.text: preheat oven to 160c.
lina a 20cm square slice tin.
combine all ingredients in a bowl.
press into tin HARD.
bake for 20 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean.
ICING.
mix all three ingredients
pour over slice and allow to cool in tin.

review.description: 5 stars plus plus !! Next time I will double the recipe as it is so wonderful.I had to use rice bubbles instead of weetbix but I don't think at the end of the day it altered the recipe much . I did not even get to ice it as I came home from work and more than half had been devoured by the children !!!
review.author: katew

jsonld.name: Cherry Nugget Pie
jsonld.author: katybugkaren
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cherry Nugget Pie recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) can sour pitted cherries, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the cherries, lemon juice, pecans and sweetened condensed milk.
Fold in whipped creme.
Pour mixture into pie crust.
Chill for 2 hours.

review.description: katybugkaren, I remember eating Cherry Nugget Pie as a little girl because I love cherries and condensed milk. When put together, they're even better! Thank you for sharing a quick and tasty pie.
review.author: Blue Peacock

ingredients.name: sour pitted cherry
ingredients.text: (16 ounce) can sour pitted cherries, drained

jsonld.name: Cherry Soup
jsonld.author: Sydney Mike
jsonld.description: There was a time when I was very much into cold fruit soups, & this is still one of my favorite recipes! The cherries amount to about 4 cups. Preparation time does not include chilling time.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large heavy saucepan, stir together all the ingredients EXCEPT the cherries.
Over medium heat, stir until thickened & smooth.
Stir in cherries & cook for 1 minute.
Pour into serving bowl, then cover & chill.
Discard cinnamon stick before serving.

review.description: This was really easy and simple to prepare and I loved it very much. I didn't have a cinnamon stick so I used 1 1/2 tsp of ground cinnamon and found that this was enough.
review.author: Studentchef

jsonld.name: Chewy Scotch Squares
jsonld.author: Bev I Am
jsonld.description: This recipe won the 5th Annual Pillsbury Grand National and Baking Contest in 1953. I found it in American Century Cookbook.
recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup peach preserves or 1/3 cup jam

recipeInstructions.text: Pre heat oven to 300.
Cover baking sheet with aluminum foil, spray with cooking spray,then turn edge up 1/2" all around; set aside.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt onto sheet of wax paper; set aside.
Melt butter in large saucepan over maderate heat.
Add sugar and stir until dissolved.
Mix in preserves, then oatmeal, then flour mixture.
Spread dough in 6" square in middle of foil on baking sheet, then bake 25-30 minutes.
Dough will spread during baking.
Cool 15 minutes, then dust with Confectioner's sugar and cut into squares.
Store in tightly cover container.

review.description: These cookies are delicious and easy to make but I would recommend spraying the aluminum foil with Pam to keep the cookies from sticking. I really wanted to spray the foil but did not see it on the directions so we had to peel the foil off the cookies. My family loved them anyway.
review.author: Marcie H

ingredients.name: apricot preserve
ingredients.text: cup peach preserves or 1/3 cup jam

jsonld.name: Cheese and Cherry Dessert
jsonld.author: toosharps
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cheese and Cherry Dessert recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup melted butter or 1/4 cup margarine

recipeInstructions.text: Mix graham crackers and butter or margarine good and spoon into 7 x 11 baking dish.
Bake at 375 for 8 minutes. Cool.
Combine and beat until smooth: cream cheese and milk.
Add: sugar, beat well, and set aside.
Prepare cool whip, then fold into cream cheese mixture. Spread this over graham cracker crust.
Spread cherry pie filling evenly over all.
Chill several hours before serving (overnight is best).

review.description: I thought this was really tasty and had a wonderful flavor. I don't think that 1/4 cup butter was enough to get the 20 crushed graham crackers moist enough. Mine crumbled and did not firm up at all. It made a big mess when scooping out I was not really sure what packaged cool whip was so I used the kind you buy pre-made in the freezer section. I think next time I make I would use 2 cans of cherry pie filling (21 oz each). It was very tasty thank you! Made for Fall PAC 2008
review.author: Proud Veterans wife

ingredients.name: butter
ingredients.text: cup melted butter or 1/4 cup margarine

jsonld.name: Chicken and Apple Salad
jsonld.author: DailyInspiration
jsonld.description:
This recipe is taken from the Gathering of Friends cookbook. I have not yet tried it, but the ingredients and the Honey-Lime dressing sound delicious.

The only change was the poaching liquid for the chicken. The recipe did not specify how to prepare the chicken; however, I have used this method before for another chicken salad recipe and it tastes great.
recipeIngredient: 2 lbs chicken tenders, poached in pineapple juice and lemon pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all ingredients. Stir in honey-lime dressing. Garnish with lemon twists and avocados (optional).

review.description: Other than leaving out the celery, and halving the recipe for 4, made this as written. A very nice flavorful dish that we enjoyed for lunch, and the chicken was very flavorful. Made for Holiday Tag.
review.author: weekend cooker

ingredients.name: chicken tender
ingredients.text: lbs chicken tenders, poached in pineapple juice and lemon pepper

jsonld.name: Cherry Chip Scones
jsonld.author: Tinkerbell
jsonld.description: Inspired by an April/May 2003 Taste of Home recipe, and adapted to fit our tastes, these have been a big hit around here & DH's work.
recipeIngredient: 2/3 cup vanilla or 2/3 cup white chocolate chips

recipeInstructions.text: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder & soda.
Cut in butter.
Combine yogurt & 1/4 cup milk; stir into flour mixture just until moistened.
Add in the cherries & chips & knead about 8-10 times.
On greased baking sheet, pat the dough into a 9-inch circle.
Cut into 8 pie shaped wedges.
Mix the 2 Tablespoons milk with the one drop of almond extract & brush over the top of each wedge.
Separate wedges slightly & bake at 400 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm with butter.

review.description: I love cherries and I love almond flavor so this was just great for us. I used my scone pan and worked perfectly as far as time and temp.
review.author: adopt a greyhound

ingredients.text: cup vanilla or 2/3 cup white chocolate chips

jsonld.name: Chicken & Rice
jsonld.author: Starrynews
jsonld.description: Recipe received from a relative. Tip - the drumsticks fit the best if you alternate the direction of the large and small ends throughout the dish.
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 ounce) envelope onion soup mix (we use Mrs. Grass)
1 (8 ounce) can sliced water chestnuts, drained
1 (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place rice in a layer on the bottom of a 9x13" glass dish.
Top with mushrooms and water chestnuts.
Combine onion soup mix, cream of mushroom soup, and water in a separate bowl, mixing well.
Place chicken in a layer on top of the rice and vegetables.
Gently pour soup mixture over the chicken.
Cook for 1 1/2 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and rice is ready.

review.description: Delicious and easy! The changes I made was using boneless chicken breasts and cooking it for 1 hour instead of the time indicated and skipping the mushrooms and water chestnuts. Delish! Thanks for sharing!
review.author: ellie_

ingredients.name: onion soup mix
ingredients.text: (1 ounce) envelope onion soup mix (we use Mrs. Grass)

ingredients.name: sliced water chestnut
ingredients.text: (8 ounce) can sliced water chestnuts, drained

ingredients.name: cream of mushroom soup
ingredients.text: (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup

jsonld.name: Chicken And Mashed Potato Bake
jsonld.author: Andrea
jsonld.description: This is a quick and very tasty dish. I found it on meals.com (courtesy of Washington Fryer Commission).
jsonld.keywords: One Dish Meal,Chicken Breast,Chicken,Poultry,Meat,Kid Friendly,< 30 Mins,Oven,Beginner Cook,Easy,Inexpensive
recipeIngredient: 4 cups frozen mashed potatoes (, prepared according to package directions) or 4 cups frozen instant mashed potatoes (, prepared according to package directions)

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare gravy mix according package directions in skillet (or you can make your own gravy).
Add chicken and frozen vegetables and return to boil.
Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Pour hot stew into 4-quart baking dish.
Spoon or pipe potatoes onto hot mixture using pastry bag and large tip.
Bake at 375 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until potato topping is lightly browned.

review.description: This is a "must have" recipe for college students and beginning cooks as it is SO EASY--especially if you use canned gravy and instant potatoes. My kids didn't complain about eating their vegetables either! I will be cooking this often on "soccer night" when I have no time to fix dinner.
review.author: SharleneW

ingredients.name: mashed potato
ingredients.text: cups frozen mashed potatoes (, prepared according to package directions) or 4 cups frozen instant mashed potatoes (, prepared according to package directions)

jsonld.name: Chicken and Pork Apritada
jsonld.author: SocaliJL
jsonld.description: This is a Filipino dish that's easy to cook and very tasty. You don't have to be precise with the chopping, it all gets mixed in like a stew and simmered. You can also vary the ingredients to your liking. Serve it with white rice. Enjoy!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup frozen peas or 1/2 cup lima beans
1/2 cup water or 1/2 cup chicken broth

recipeInstructions.text: Chop chicken, pork, sausage, and potatoes into serving size pieces.
Heat oil in large heavy pot.
Sauté garlic and onion for a few minutes until fragrant.
Add pork, sausage, chicken, chopped tomato, salt and pepper.
Sauté for about 5 minutes.
Add tomato sauce and soy sauce to color.
Add enough water or chicken broth to cook meat.
Cover and simmer until meat is tender then add potatoes.
When potatoes are almost done, add bell pepper and peas and cook for additional 5 minutes.

review.description: This was easy to prepare and I enjoyed it. I used the chicken broth and the peas. The flavor was really good and I didn't change or add anything! Made for Fall PAC 2007
review.author: SimplyME

ingredients.name: frozen pea
ingredients.text: cup frozen peas or 1/2 cup lima beans

ingredients.name: water
ingredients.text: cup water or 1/2 cup chicken broth

jsonld.name: Cheesy Tuna Casserole
jsonld.author: AngelaTN
jsonld.description: My mom made this for us the other night and my family devoured it. This is comfort food at its finest!

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350.
Cook noodles and drain.
Mix sour cream and cottage cheese into cooked noodles.
Stir in tuna and chopped onion.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour into greased casserole and top with cheese.
Cook at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

review.description:
This should get 5 stars x2..I made this for the 3 of us at home, then my adult son arrived to pick up some mail..noticed the rest of the casserole in the kithen and says...'mmm dinner?' well a Mum cant see her kids starve can she? so in to a container it goes and feeds another 2 adults..lol
Great tuna casserole..I only had 1 cup of sour cream and I used 3 spring onions instead of an onion..will definitely make again.
review.author: Evie3234

jsonld.name: Chicken Breasts in Poblano Sauce
jsonld.author: Leslie in Texas
jsonld.description: This yummy recipe comes from Jalapenos, a local Mexican restaurant. It was originally published in the Houston Chronicle food section, in an article for Cinco de Mayo.I have made it with light butter and fat-free heavy cream or half-and-half to cut down on the fat grams and it is still delicious!

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
Pound chicken breasts flat and season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, rub poblano with olive oil and place on a foil covered baking sheet and roast for 3 to 4 minutes, or until skin blackens.
Remove from oven and rub off outer skin with a towel ( I use a damp paper towel).
Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees.
Melt 2 Tablespoons of butter in a small saucepan.
Add flour and stir over medium heat until thick.
In a blender or food processor,pure'e half of the poblano together with the milk.
Add to the flour mixture, mix well, and whisk in heavy cream.
Cook over low heat until thick and bubbly, stirring often. Add salt to taste.
Melt remaining butter in an ovenproof pan over medium-high heat and sear chicken breasts for 3 minutes on each side.
Cut remaining poblano in strips.
Cover chicken breasts with poblano strips,sauce and cheese.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until cheese has melted.

review.description: This is incredibly good!! I used 2 poblano peppers and roasted for more like 10 minutes, removed the skin and put one in the sauce and the other sliced on the chicken. I used pepper jack cheese instead of cheddar and it was perfect for this dish....added a tad more heat. The chicken breasts were large so I baked for 20 minutes total. I can't wait to eat the leftover for lunch this week!! I find the flavor of the poblanos get better with time. This is going into my keeper file. Thanks Leslie in Texas....I'm in Texas too!!
review.author: PleasantNancy

jsonld.name: Chicken Breasts With Mushrooms and Tarragon
jsonld.author: Lorrie in Montreal
jsonld.description: Make and share this Chicken Breasts With Mushrooms and Tarragon recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 lb assorted mushroom (white and cremini, trimmed and sliced, shiitake, stems removed and caps sliced)
2 tablespoons chopped fresh tarragon or 1 teaspoon dried tarragon
6 small boneless skinless chicken breast halves (1-1/2 lbs)

recipeInstructions.text: In 12-inch skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium-high heat.
Add mushrooms and shallot and cook, stirring occasionally, until mushrooms are golden brown and any liquid has been evaporated, 12 to 15 minutes.
Transfer mushroom mixture to bowl.
On waxed paper, combine flour, 1 tablespoon chopped tarragon, salt and pepper; use flour mixture to coat chicken, shaking off excess.
In same skillet, heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil over medium-heat until very hot.
Add chicken and cook until chicken is golden brown and loses its pink color throughout, about 4 minutes per side.
Transfer chicken to warm platter.
Add broth, wine, remaining 1 tablespoon chopped tarragon, and mushroom mixture to skillet; cook 1 minute, stirring until browned bits are loosened from bottom of skillet.
Pour sauce over chicken.

review.description: This was just ok. The sauce was very dark (from the m'room?) and wasn't attractive looking at all. I absolutely love chicken and mushrooms, but this didn't have much flavor, even tho I love tarragon and kept adding more. Sorry, but I won't make this again.

itemReviewed.name: Chicken Breasts With Mushrooms and Tarragon

review.author: pgarrison12

ingredients.name: mushroom
ingredients.text: lb assorted mushroom (white and cremini, trimmed and sliced, shiitake, stems removed and caps sliced)

ingredients.name: fresh tarragon
ingredients.text: tablespoons chopped fresh tarragon or 1 teaspoon dried tarragon

ingredients.name: chicken breast half
ingredients.text: small boneless skinless chicken breast halves (1-1/2 lbs)

jsonld.name: Chicken Bacon Sub Sandwiches (Oamc)
jsonld.author: mlworrell
jsonld.description: Make and share this Chicken Bacon Sub Sandwiches (Oamc) recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 loaf French bread, large, sliced lengthwise
5 ounces mozzarella cheese or 5 ounces monterey jack cheese, sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Place French loaf on large sheet of aluminum foil. Spread garlic butter on bottom half of bread. Spread shredded chicken across garlic butter. Sprinkle with bacon. Layer cheese over top.
Place top half of bread over cheese. Wrap in foil.
If serving right away, bake in 350 oven for about 25 minutes.
If preparing to serve later, freeze. On serving day, bake for 50-70 minutes if frozen. If thawed, bake for 25-30 minutes.

review.description: Very tasty. I used pepper jack cheese, and my husband added whipped dressing to his sandwich. I will definitely make these again. Next time, I'd like to try freezing them as suggested.
review.author: Terri Newell

ingredients.name: french bread
ingredients.text: loaf French bread, large, sliced lengthwise

ingredients.name: mozzarella
ingredients.text: ounces mozzarella cheese or 5 ounces monterey jack cheese, sliced

jsonld.name: Chicken Burgers With Avocado Salsa
jsonld.author: ImPat
jsonld.description: From Super Food Ideas. A healthy low fat burger recipes with lots of flavour. Portuguese seasoning was specified but I couldn't find it or a recipe to make it, so have suggested Italian seasoning.
recipeIngredient: 4 hamburger buns (split and toasted wholemeal or wholegrain)

recipeInstructions.text: Slice each chicken breast in half lengthways and place chicken between 2 sheets of baking paper and using the flat side of a meat mallet, pound chicken until 1cm thick.
Place oil, seasoning, oregano and garlic in a glass or ceramic bowl and add chicken and toss to coast and cover and refrigerate until needed.
Place avocado, corn, capsicum and lemon juice in a bowl and toss gently to combine, cover and set aside.
Heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium high heat and cook chicken in 2 batrches for 3 to 4 minutes each side or until cooked through and transfer to a plate, cover with foil to keep worm.
Spread the base of each bread roll with mayonnaise and top with salad leaves, chicken breast and avocado mixture and top with roll tops and serve.

review.description: Our family loved these chicken burgers with avocado salsa. I appreciated the fact that they were healthy. It's simple to prepare and really tasty. The chicken has very good flavor. I especially loved the avocado salsa. The only thing I did differently was to use a whole avocado. Thanks for sharing!
review.author: LifeIsGood

ingredients.name: hamburger bun
ingredients.text: hamburger buns (split and toasted wholemeal or wholegrain)

jsonld.name: Chicken and Spaghetti Noodle Casserole
jsonld.author: Red Chef Mama
jsonld.description: A nice thick chicken noodle soup casserole, don't skimp on the mozzarella cheese, this makes it even better!
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup
1 (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of chicken soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees (farenheit).
Cook chicken breasts until no longer pink and shred.
Boil the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
In a large bowl combine the soups, sour cream and milk until well blended, adding salt and pepper to taste.
Add the shredded chicken, cooked spaghetti and frozen vegetables, stir well to blend.
Pour mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Sprinkle cheese on top of mixture in dish.
Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and starting to brown slightly.

review.description: Delicious! I submitted the photo. Left the reservation, instead of shredding the chicken, I used grilled strips of chicken breasts, left them whole. Only had frozen corn, next time I'll try broccoli.
review.author: Daniel S.

ingredients.text: (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup
(10 3/4 ounce) can cream of chicken soup

jsonld.name: Chicken Curry (Crock Pot)
jsonld.author: Northern_Reflectionz
jsonld.description: Make and share this Chicken Curry (Crock Pot) recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of chicken soup
fluffy cooked rice (or saffron rice to serve 4)

recipeInstructions.text: Cut chicken into small piece and place in crock pot.
Add all remaining ingredients except rice.
Cover, cook high 2 1/2 to 4 hours.
Serve over hot rice.

review.description: I think this was good but for our tastes it was also very salty reduced to 1t. Next time plan to reduce to 1/2t or adding salt to taste afterwards but otherwise yummy.
review.author: Mosquito 2

ingredients.name: cream of chicken soup
ingredients.text: (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of chicken soup

ingredients.name: cooked rice
ingredients.text: fluffy cooked rice (or saffron rice to serve 4)

jsonld.name: Chicken Fingers With Plum Dipping Sauce
jsonld.author: Sydney Mike
jsonld.description: From Elizabeth Baird's Cook's Own 'Chicken' cookbook, 2006, a copy of which I received in a recent cookbook swap!

recipeInstructions.text: FOR FINGERS ~ Preheat oven to 400°F & grease a rimmed baking sheet well.
Cut each chicken breast crosswise into 4 or 5 strips, then pat dry.
Place cracker crumbs in shallow dish, & put mayaonnaise in a bowl.
Add chicken strips to mayo & turn to coat all over.
Transfer chicken strips, one at a time, to cracker crumbs, patting crumbs all over the chicken strip.
Arrange chicken strips in single layer on prepared baking sheet, & bake 15 minutes.
Turn strips over & bake another 10 to 12 minutes more or until golden & no longer pink inside.
FOR DIPPING SAUCE ~ While fingers are baking, In a small serving bowl, stir together ketchup, plum sauce & soy sauce.
Place in center of serving platter, & when fingers are baked, arrange them around the bowl.

review.description: I picked this recipe to use up some plum sauce from the Chinese restaurant. I really screwed it up, though, because I only had about 1 1/2 T left. So I tried to make up the difference with oyster sauce, which was a bad move. It made the dipping sauce way too salty. The chicken was really good, though. I served this with Recipe #133821.

itemReviewed.name: Chicken Fingers With Plum Dipping Sauce

review.author: evewitch

jsonld.name: Chicken Fritters
jsonld.author: LAURIE
jsonld.description: Everything all mixed together in one serving! Good with tomatoe sauce but I like them with chicken gravy.
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon mixed herbs (tarragon and parsley works nice as does garlic and parsley)

recipeInstructions.text: Blend potatoes, chicken, ham, herbs and 1 egg.
Add cheese and/or corn if desired.
Blend well and season with salt and pepper.
Shape into small balls or flat pancakes.
Add small amount of milk to second egg.
Place crumbs on a plate.
Dip balls into the egg and milk.
Roll in bread crumbs to coat throughly.
Heat oil in large skillet.
Cook fritters until golden brown.

review.description: Great way to use up Thanksgiving leftover mashed potatoes and turkey. We did not use the corn this time but next will try that option.
review.author: karen in tbay

ingredients.name: mixed herb
ingredients.text: tablespoon mixed herbs (tarragon and parsley works nice as does garlic and parsley)

jsonld.name: Chicken Coating Mix
jsonld.author: CookinwithGas
jsonld.description: You know, I really hate it when a company starts mucking around with their 'formula' for a well-liked product...and then changes it! EXAMPLE: Shake 'n' Bake...a few years ago I bought a box and I immediately noted there was a difference from what I'd remembered...I swallowed my disappointment, never bought the stuff again and started looking at recipes...The following recipe is the best result of my research/attempts thus far...

recipeInstructions.text: Place all ingredients in a Ziploc bag and shake well to combine.
Store in a cool dry place and use within 6 mos.

NOTE: When ready to use, simply grab some boneless skinless chicken breasts, dip them, one at a time into either water, melted butter, milk, or beaten egg; then place the dipped chicken one at a time into the baggie and shake to coat; then bake the chicken on an ungreased cookie sheet in a 350°F oven for 1 hour or until chicken is 170° or their juices run clear.

review.description:
Ran out of shake n bake so I thought I would try this one.
I followed the recipe and used egg to dip the chicken in then into the coating mix.
Baked at the degree and time noted in recipe.
350 is not hot enough for bone in thighs. Chicken was 1 hour 45 minutes to get done.Should bake at 400 for at least 45 minutes thn check for doneness.
There was not a lot of flavor but I do think that this recipe would be better with more robust and flavorful seasonings. I did not need all of what the recipe made so I froze the rest and will use it with an Italian dish or meatballs or something. I think that this is oK but I think that it could be better.
She has a good start on something here that could be quite good.
review.author: KGCOOK

jsonld.name: Chicken Divan for Two
jsonld.author: Nana Lee
jsonld.description: You will need 2 12x18 inch sheets heavy duty aluminum foil to make these. This can be made in the oven or on the grill. Found on Reynolds Aluminum Foil site.
recipeIngredient: 2 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (.5 to .67 lbs.)
1 (10 3/4 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 450ºF or grill to medium-high.
Center one chicken breast half on each sheet of heavy duty foil.
Combine rice, soup and water; spoon over chicken.
Arrange broccoli and mushrooms on top of chicken and rice mixture.
Top with ice cubes.
Bring up foil sides.
Double fold top and ends to seal packet, leaving room for heat circulation inside.
Repeat to make two packets.
Bake 24 to 26 minutes on a cookie sheet in oven or grill 14 to 16 minutes in covered grill.
Sprinkle with cheese before serving.

review.description: Great dinner. Easy and fast for a week night. Also very tastey. Will definitely make again.
review.author: Pepper Monkey

ingredients.name: chicken breast half
ingredients.text: boneless skinless chicken breast halves (.5 to .67 lbs.)

ingredients.name: condensed cream of chicken soup
ingredients.text: (10 3/4 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup

jsonld.name: Chicken and Broccoli Pasta Bake
jsonld.author: MarieRynr
jsonld.description: Make and share this Chicken and Broccoli Pasta Bake recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 8 ounces broccoli, cut into very small florets and the stems thinly sliced
12 ounces boneless skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
1 (80 g) packet soft spreadable cheese with garlic and herbs (such as Boursin)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375*F.
Cook the pasta in a large pan of boiling salted water for 6 minutes, then add the broccoli and cook for 5 to 6 minutes longer, until the pasta is just cooked.
Drain well and return to pan.
Heat the oil in a wide pan and add the chicken pieces.
Fry until lightly browned.
Tip in the mushrooms and stir fry for 1 minute, then stir in the tomato paste, cheese and cream.
Gently simmer until the cheese has melted, stirring, until the sauce is thickened slightly.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour the sauce over the pasta, stirring gently until coated, then tip into a shallow ovenproof dish.
Level the top.
Mix the spring onions, cheddar, garlic and almonds and sprinkle over the pasta.
Bake for 20 minutes until golden.

review.description: This was very yummy. I used cream cheese for the spreadable cheese and skipped the cheese and almond topping.
review.author: stilltall

ingredients.text: ounces broccoli, cut into very small florets and the stems thinly sliced
ounces boneless skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
(80 g) packet soft spreadable cheese with garlic and herbs (such as Boursin)

jsonld.name: Chicken In Shallot Gravy
jsonld.author: Minxkat1
jsonld.description: This is one of my favorite ways to 'do up' chicken. I adapted it from an Old Bon Appetite recipe. I usually serve it with Italian bread, steamed green beans, and mashed potatoes to soak up the flavorful sauce. I used Lennie's wonderful Turkey Stock in place of the Chicken broth the last time I made this - it worked wonderfully!

recipeInstructions.text: I use an electric frying pan with a lid to make this recipe.
Pour olive oil into pan, heat to 375 F.
Add chicken, sprinkle salt, pepper and a generous amount of Paprika over chicken to taste.
Turn chicken and fry until both sides are golden, about 10 minutes.
Transfer chicken to plate.
Add shallots to frying pan.
Stir up any brown bits, cover and let cook, stirring occasionally until tender, about 8 minutes.
Put chicken back in pan, on top of onions.
Add bay leaves to pan, pour wine over top of chicken.
Heat until most of wine has evaportated, leaving a syrupy mixture, about another 8 minutes.
Pour chicken (or turkey) broth over chicken.
Turn heat down to 325 F, cover and cook for 30 minutes.
Remove chicken from pan, whisk in whipping cream (not whipped) and nutmeg until incoporated into the sauce.
Return chicken to pan, turning to coat with sauce, and warm on low heat for about five minutes.

review.description: Fast and easy. I also served with mashed potatoes. I might toss in some garlic next time for just a bit more taste.
review.author: Kasha

jsonld.name: Chicken and Veggie Couscous
jsonld.author: Jencathen
jsonld.description: Make and share this Chicken and Veggie Couscous recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 2 lbs chicken breasts, boneless, skinless cut into 1 inch cubes
2 medium onions, diced (I just throw them in the food processor)
1 (10 ounce) box of quick cooking couscous

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a 12-inch skillet over med-high heat.
Add chicken and cook until well browned on all sides.
With a slotted spoon, remove chicken to a plate.
Reduce heat to medium. Cook carrots, zucchini, and onions in drippings for 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 2 minutes more, stirring frequently.
Grab a pot because this makes a lot. Transfer your carrots, zucchini, and onions to it.
Stir chicken broth, pepper sauce, curry powder, salt and chicken.
Bring to a boil, add couscous, cover and remove from heat for 5 minutes.
Stir in almonds and parsley.

review.description: Delicious! I used left over grilled chicken and yellow squash. The flavors were wonderful and the almonds were a really nice crunch. Thanks for sharing!
review.author: TattooedMamaof2

ingredients.name: chicken breast
ingredients.text: lbs chicken breasts, boneless, skinless cut into 1 inch cubes

ingredients.name: onion
ingredients.text: medium onions, diced (I just throw them in the food processor)

ingredients.name: couscou
ingredients.text: (10 ounce) box of quick cooking couscous

jsonld.name: Chicken in Apple and Garlic
jsonld.author: Mirj2338
jsonld.description: Make and share this Chicken in Apple and Garlic recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: salt, pepper and mustard powder,to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place the salt, pepper and mustard powder in a plastic bag with the flour.
Shake the chicken in the bag until it is well coated with the seasoned flour.
Heat the oil in a heavy saucepan and saute the chicken on all sides.
Remove and drain.
Saute the onion.
Add the apple juice and garlic.
Add the rest of the seasonings, orange peel and chicken.
Pour into an ovenproof dish and cook in a medium oven (180 degrees Celsius) for about 45 minutes.

review.description: This was a good recipe, easy to make, and turned out well. I felt something was missing... maybe some brown sugar (or is that just my sweet tooth talking?) or some sliced apple. Next time I will try adding both. I served with rice, broccoli and carrots.
review.author: cpenner

ingredients.name: salt
ingredients.text: salt, pepper and mustard powder,to taste

jsonld.name: Chicken Khao Soi
jsonld.author: rpgaymer
jsonld.description: "A simple curry paste gives this northern Thai–inspired soup surprising depth of flavor." - Bon Appetit .... EDIT: So I finally made this, and it came out tasting incredible. The soup is a delicious but unexciting Asian noodle soup; the add-ins are what really make it shine though. I served each bowl with limes, bean sprouts, fresh cilantro leaves, sambal oelek and crispy fried onions. I'd recommend the fried onions especially.
recipeIngredient: 4 large dried guajillo chilies, stemmed & halved & seeded
1 1/2 lbs boneless skinless chicken thighs, halved lengthwise
1 lb ramen noodles or 1 lb rice noodles
1 tablespoon palm sugar or 1 tablespoon brown sugar
sliced red onion, bean sprouts, cilantro sprigs, crispy fried onions, chili oil, and lime wedges (all optional for serving)

recipeInstructions.text: Place chiles in a small heatproof bowl, add boiling water to cover, and let soak until softened, 25–30 minutes.

Drain chiles, reserving soaking liquid. Purée chiles, shallots, garlic, ginger, cilantro, coriander, turmeric, curry powder, and 2 tablespoons soaking liquid in a food processor, adding more soaking liquid by tablespoonfuls, if needed, until smooth. You've just made khao soi paste!

Heat oil in a large heavy pot over medium heat. Add khao soi paste; cook, stirring constantly, until slightly darkened, 4–6 minutes. Add coconut milk and broth. Bring to a boil; add chicken. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is fork-tender, 20–25 minutes. Transfer chicken to a plate. Let cool slightly; shred meat.
Meanwhile, cook noodles according to package directions.
Add chicken, 3 tablespoons fish sauce, and sugar to soup. Season with salt and/or more fish sauce, if needed. Divide soup and noodles among bowls and serve with toppings.

review.description: this soup was pretty incredible! An instant favourite, it is so rich, creamy and coconutty. Really loved it!
review.author: LimeandSpoon

ingredients.text: lbs boneless skinless chicken thighs, halved lengthwise

ingredients.text: lb ramen noodles or 1 lb rice noodles

ingredients.text: tablespoon palm sugar or 1 tablespoon brown sugar
