jsonld.name: Crab Sandwiches
jsonld.author: IngridH
jsonld.description: My mom made these when I was a little girl, and I've always loved them. Mom always served them for dinner, but they would also be great for a brunch, or lunch. Now that I'm an adult, this was one of the recipes that was important for me to get and keep for the generations to come. I hope you enjoy it as much as I do. Feel free to add hot sauce or red pepper if you prefer a kick in your sandwich.
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 ounces sharp cheddar cheese, grated plus more for topping

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F.
Split english muffins, and place on a greased baking sheet.
Combine crab, mayo, and onion. Mix until completely combined. (You may add more or less mayo depending on how "wet" you like this mixture.).
Taste, and add salt and pepper as necessary.
Spread crab mixture evenly over the muffin halves.
In a small saucepan, over medium heat, melt the butter.
Add the flour, and whisk to combine. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Stir in milk, and whisk to keep lumps from forming.
When milk is hot (DO NOT BOIL), add the cheese, continuing to stir constantly, until the cheese is fully melted, and the sauce thickens.
Taste, and add salt and pepper as necessary.
Top the muffins with the sauce.
Sprinkle with extra cheese to taste, and with paprika for color.
Bake at 350 F for 20 minutes, or until the sauce is golden and bubbly.
Serve immediately.

review.description: Thank you to Ingrid and her Mom for this recipe. I made these the other day and they came out great! I only had four english muffins on hand so we all just had some extra crab mixture on our muffins. I grated about 3 oz of extra cheddar for on top and that really made these taste outstanding. I will definately make these again.
review.author: Mimma

ingredients.name: cheddar
ingredients.text: ounces sharp cheddar cheese, grated plus more for topping

jsonld.name: Crab Frittata
jsonld.author: JustJanS
jsonld.description: Yet another way to make use of those big blue crabs we are catching. 1 crab gave us 1 cup of beautiful meat for this.I can't do what I suggest in the last step as I don't have a griller (broiler) so I finished it with the lid on for a couple of minutes to set the top. That worked fine and would be good for camping. Just cook the onion and potato slower and longer if you can't access a microwave.
recipeIngredient: 1 large potato, cut into tiny dice

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the eggs, cream, lemon rind, tabasco, salt and pepper together. Set aside.
Microwave onion and potato about 3 minutes (to speed up cooking).
Heat oil in frying pan over medium heat and brown potato and onion and cook them through.
Add the capsicum and cook a few minutes more.
Pour over the egg mix and scatter the crab across the top.
Cook gently for about 5 minutes or until almost set through, then place under a griller (broiler) to brown the top. Serve at once.

review.description: DH and I made this frittata for brunch today. We enjoyed it and thought it to be a nice alternative to the traditional frittata that we are used to making (mostly herb and mushroom). We both thought it needed a little extra flavor, so we served with DH's homemade habanero sauce on top, which did the trick nicely. The recipe doesn't specify, so DH put the cheese on top of the frittata just before baking in the oven. All in all, this was a nice dish and could easily serve 3 people. Thanks!
review.author: Dr. Jenny

ingredients.name: potato
ingredients.text: large potato, cut into tiny dice

jsonld.name: Cozy Chicken Parmesan Casserole
jsonld.author: Elizabeth H.
jsonld.description: This family pleasing recipe is hearty and easy to make. Savory flavors of chicken, rice and spices meld in a creamy parmesan sauce. Yet it takes only minutes to prepare! This is my own, original recipe. Tested at high altitude.
jsonld.keywords: Chicken Breast,Chicken,Poultry,Meat,Low Cholesterol,Healthy,Kid Friendly,Oven,Beginner Cook,< 4 Hours,Easy,Inexpensive
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can cream of chicken soup, 99% fat free
4 boneless skinless chicken breasts (fresh or thawed)
1 tablespoon chives, freeze-dried or fresh snipped, for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Combine 1 cup chicken broth with 2 teaspoons poultry seasoning, 1 Tbl. dried minced onion and 2 teaspoons onion powder in small saucepan. Bring to boil.
Add 1/2 cup white rice.
Cover, reduce heat and boil for 10-12 minutes (depending on altitude; 12 minutes at altitudes above 3500 feet).

Meanwhile, in medium mixing bowl, combine frozen mixed vegetables with remaining chicken broth, 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1/2 cup parmesan cheese (note: I buy shredded parmesan in bulk and freeze it; OK to use frozen parmesan in this recipe), and remaining poultry seasonning and onion powder.
When rice has finished parboiling, remove from heat and combine with vegetable mixture.
Spread rice-vegetable mixture in shallow 2-quart casserole or 13x9x2 pan sprayed with non-stick cooking spray.
Lay chicken breasts atop rice mixture. Dust with salt (minimal, since condensed soup is so salty), pepper, additional onion powder and poultry seasoning.
Bake, uncovered for 45 minutes.
Add 2 Tbl. shredded parmesan and 1 Tbl. snipped chives and return to oven for 15 minutes.
Serve hot.
Note: At altitudes below 3500 feet, you may need to reduce liquids and/or cooking time.

review.description: We really enjoyed this recipe. I made it exactly as written. It was easy to prepare and very tasty.
review.author: Wind in the Canyon

ingredients.text: (10 1/2 ounce) can cream of chicken soup, 99% fat free
boneless skinless chicken breasts (fresh or thawed)
tablespoon chives, freeze-dried or fresh snipped, for garnish

jsonld.name: Crab Appetizers
jsonld.author: Just Cher
jsonld.description: Make and share this Crab Appetizers recipe from Food.com.

recipeInstructions.text: Separate biscuits.
Divide each biscuit into 3 parts.
You will end up with 30 pieces.
Place on a cookie sheet and bake 8-10 minutes.
Spread generously with cream cheese.
Sprinkle with seasoning salt.
Top with crab meat.
Top with grated cheeses.
Sprinkle with dill.
Bake or broil until cheese is melted.

review.description:
I wish I could give this more than 5 stars! I made these last night using leftover king crab legs. Wow! I did use chive-flavored cream cheese, and I added a thin slice of fresh avacado before covering with the cheese. These are so easy and so wonderful! Definitely a keeper! Thank you for sharing your recipe.
--Marla, AZ
review.author: barbie66

jsonld.name: Crabby Potato Cakes
jsonld.author: ciquento
jsonld.description:
Ready, Set, Cook! Special Edition Contest Entry: I love crab cakes and potato pancakes and this recipe is a great combo of both loves. I wasn't sure if I should make a suace but while my husband was scarfing down his third crabby potato cake he said their good just like this.
I would fry the cakes in small batches so they don't burn.
May serve with fresh lime wedges.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups Simply Potatoes® Shredded Hash Browns

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all ingredients except oil in a large bowl; mixing well. Form into 10 crabby potato cakes. Meanwhile heat oil in a large skillet. Cook cakes 3 minutes on one side and after flipping carefully cook another 2 minutes. Drain cakes on plate lined with paper towel and keep warm until all cakes are cooked.

review.description: I made this recipe for company. They could not stop talking about it and even the guys were asking for the recipe. What a great appitizer.
review.author: cindy

ingredients.text: cups Simply Potatoes® Shredded Hash Browns

jsonld.name: Cracker Barrel Green Chili Jack Chicken
jsonld.author: mydesigirl
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cracker Barrel Green Chili Jack Chicken recipe from Food.com.
jsonld.keywords: Chicken,Poultry,Meat,Very Low Carbs,High Protein,High In...,< 30 Mins,Beginner Cook,Easy

recipeInstructions.text: Spray a medium size frypan with cooking spray.
Sprinkle chili powder over chicken.
Cook chicken strips until no longer pink.
Turn stove top on low and add green chilis on top of chicken.
Cook until chilis are warmed.
Add cheese and cook until melted on top of chilis.
Put on a dish and serve with salsa on the side.

review.description: 3 at best. VERY MILD for those that like that. those that want flavor - add jalapeno's - medium to hot salsa, chili pepper with pepper flakes - this was just TOO mild with NO taste,for me.

itemReviewed.name: Cracker Barrel Green Chili Jack Chicken

review.author: chDoog

jsonld.name: Cornflake Garlic Sticks
jsonld.author: Sharon123
jsonld.description: This was on the side of our cornflakes box and I thought I would share. It's easy and quick to make and would be fun for the kids to help with.
jsonld.keywords: Grains,Kid Friendly,Weeknight,< 30 Mins,For Large Groups,Beginner Cook,Easy,Inexpensive

recipeInstructions.text: Crush cornflakes by putting in plastic zip lock bag and rolling over it with a rolling pin or pound with meat tenderizer(or other fairly heavy object) to crush but not to powder.
Cut each biscuit in half.
Roll into sticks 5"-6" long.
Dip each stick into milk. Roll in crushed cornflakes.
Sprinkle with garlic salt.
Place on buttered baking sheet 1" apart.
Bake in a 450*F. oven for 7-10 minutes.

review.description:
YUM!!! I made these for dinner this evening~ they are wonderful..I will be making these often.
I followed the recipe to a "T" and made a garlic/cream cheese dip for them.
Thank you for sharing this winner Sharon!
review.author: MaMere

jsonld.name: Country Sausage Casserole
jsonld.author: luvinlif2k
jsonld.description: The Maple flavoring in this recipe adds a nice breakfast twist. Cook time includes 5 hours setting time (can be done overnight).
recipeIngredient: 2 cups American cheese, grated (Schreiber's white American is the creamiest)
1 (10 1/2 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Place bread cubes in a greased 9x13-inch pan.
Sprinkle with cheese.
Scatter browned sausage evenly over top.
Blend eggs, 2 1/2 cups milk and mustard and pour over ingredients in the pan.
Refrigerate overnight (or for 5 hours).
Blend soup and 1/2 cup milk and pour evenly over the top.
Bake 1 1/2 hours at 350°F.

review.description: OMG this is to die for! We've had it with maple sausage, and then with half hot sausage and half regular sausage (reduced-fat). I think it's better without the maple sausage, but either way, this recipe is awesome.
review.author: Kathy

ingredients.text: cups American cheese, grated (Schreiber's white American is the creamiest)
(10 1/2 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

jsonld.name: Country Fried Steak and Pan Gravy
jsonld.author: Marg CaymanDesigns
jsonld.description: My husband's great aunt taught me how to make this as it is my hubby's favorite meal. It is one of those things that I cook by eyeballing the ingredients but someone requested I post it so the amounts are guesstimates with instructions on what the mixture should look like. Serve with mashed potatoes and Recipe #268494.

recipeInstructions.text: For steak: Melt butter & oil in an electric skillet set on about 350°F
Dredge cube steak in flour seasoned with salt & pepper mixture. (I have done it dipping it in egg first & didn't think it made that much difference).
Fry about 5 minutes on each side. (If you over cook it gets tough.) Move cooked steak to a small cookie sheet & place in a warmed oven.
For the gravy: Pour any butter and oil out of the skillet, being careful to not pour off the browned flour that are in the pan. Loosen the bits of browned flour from the pan with your spatula.
Turn the heat down to about 250°F and melt 4-8 Tbls of butter stirring the pan drippings into it. (The more butter you start with, the more gravy you'll have. My family likes LOTS of gravy!).
Once the butter has browned a bit add enough flour to absorb all the butter, mixing well. (You will use approximately the same amount of flour as butter.).

Start adding milk about 1/2 cup at a time while using a whisk to work it into the flour/butter mixture. After I have added about 2 cups of milk I start using water. Add liquid until the gravy is as thin as you like it. This takes a little time especially when you are first getting used to it. Add some liquid, mix, add liquid, mix --
Once the gravy is the right consistency add some salt & pepper until it is to your liking (I used quite a bit of salt actually).
Remove steak from oven & serve with mashed potatoes!

(Hint: have the rest if the meal done before you start the steak & gravy. Once you are into making the gravy you won't be able to do anything else because you have to stir it constantly so it doesn't stick or burn).

review.description: I was looking for something to do with cube steaks and something I had all the ingredients for so I made this and it was really good! My kids that can be picky about meat liked it and I love using the electric skillet. The directions were perfect and so easy to follow!

itemReviewed.name: Country Fried Steak and Pan Gravy

review.author: Brie C

jsonld.name: Cranberry and Wild Blueberry Pie
jsonld.author: conniecooks
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cranberry and Wild Blueberry Pie recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) can whole berry cranberry sauce (you can make your own)
2 cups fresh blueberries or 2 cups frozen blueberries

recipeInstructions.text: In a mixing bowl blend brown sugar, granulated sugar, cornstarch, & salt.
Stir in cranberry sauce, orange juice , & orange zest until well combined.
Stir in blueberries.
Line a 9" pie plate with half of the pie crust.
Spoon in filling.
Dot with butter.
Top with top crust.
Trim & seal edges.
Cut slits to allow steam to escape.
Bake at 425F for 40 minutes or until crust is golden.

review.description:
Wonderful! Excellent pie, made this for a change for Thanksgiving dessert and everyone loved it.

Thank you for posting it.
review.author: Thymestudio

ingredients.name: whole berry cranberry sauce
ingredients.text: (14 ounce) can whole berry cranberry sauce (you can make your own)

ingredients.name: fresh blueberry
ingredients.text: cups fresh blueberries or 2 cups frozen blueberries

jsonld.name: Cranberry Camembert Chicken
jsonld.author: Sonya01
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cranberry Camembert Chicken recipe from Food.com.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut a deep pocket in the side of each chicken breast.
Fill pockets with cheese slices, secure with toothpicks.
Toss filled chicken in flour, dip into combined egg and water, press firmly into combined breadcrumbs and sesame seeds.
Cover and refrigerate chicken for 30mins before cooking.
Heat oil in large pan, add chicken; cook over medium heat until crumbs are golden and chicken is cooked, turning once during cooking.
Drain on absorbent paper.
Serve with cranberry sauce and salad, if desired.

review.description: Made as a bonus for Aus/NZ Swap #14. We spent a holiday in Normandy a few years ago, and camembert became one of our favorite French cheeses (of 365, as de Gaulle said !) I had nice thick chicken breasts, but became acutely aware that "pockets" were not my strong suite ! The outcome wasn't too pretty, but it was surely tasty ! Thanks, Sonya !
review.author: NurseJaney

jsonld.name: Cranberry Orange Brie
jsonld.author: norava
jsonld.description: Delicious. The color of the cranberry topped brie is beautiful on any fall/winter table. My aunt just asked for this recipe and that made me think of posting it here to share with everyone!

recipeInstructions.text: Combine Cranberry sauce, brown sugar, orange extract and nutmeg.
Peel (or scrape) off top rind of a round 8 oz brie, leaving a 1/4" rim.
Top with cranberry mixture.
Sprinkle with pecans.
Bake in 500 degree oven 5 minutes.
I like to serve this with plain water crackers, such as made by Carr.

review.description:
Thanks for adding a festive and gourmet touch to my family's Thanksgiving. I made this as part of the appetizer/relish tray I make each year. 

The cranberry and orange really taste good with the brie. I used a wheat cracker assortment. Delicious and festive. Thanks for sharing!
review.author: Amber of AZ

jsonld.name: Crawfish (Shrimp) and Corn Soup
jsonld.author: Dee514
jsonld.description: Hubby had this soup in New Orleans when we were visiting friends. He loved it, and asked for the recipe. He has made it several times since then, usually when he is "on his own" for dinner (its very easy to prepare). Being a vegetarian--I've never tried it, so I don't have an opinion.
recipeIngredient: 1 lb crawfish or 1 lb fresh shrimp, cleaned
2 (10 3/4 ounce) cans cream of potato soup
1 (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, over medium heat, sauté onions and mushrooms in butter and a little garlic powder until tender.
Soften cream cheese in microwave, and add to onions and mushrooms.
Lower heat to medium-low and add soups and corn, stir well.
Add crawfish or shrimp and half-and-half.
Season to taste with Tabasco sauce and Tony's Creole seasoning.
Cook for about 20 to 25 minutes.

review.description: Fantastic recipe. I live in the New Orleans/Baton Rouge area. This is as good as any I have had around here. I suggest fresh garlic though instead of the powder and make a double batch and add a pound of lump crab meat as well.
review.author: swampwaterbrewing

ingredients.name: crawfish
ingredients.text: lb crawfish or 1 lb fresh shrimp, cleaned

ingredients.name: cream of potato soup
ingredients.text: (10 3/4 ounce) cans cream of potato soup

ingredients.name: cream of mushroom soup
ingredients.text: (10 3/4 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup

jsonld.name: Cranberry Lemon Cookies
jsonld.author: Chef MB
jsonld.description: These are fast and easy, my favorite combo! They have a pleasant tartness that makes them a nice change from overly sweet cookies, and they only require 3 ingredients!
jsonld.keywords: Dessert,Cookie & Brownie,Low Protein,Low Cholesterol,Healthy,< 15 Mins,For Large Groups,Easy

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the cake mix with the cranberry sauce. If the batter seems too thick, add up to 4 TB of the applesauce.
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes, allowing less time for smaller cookies and more time for larger cookies.

review.description: Loved the taste of these cookies! We were eating them as they came out of the oven! The only addition I made to the recipe was to add the zest of a lemon. Will be making these again. Thnx for posting, Chef MB.
review.author: Darkhunter

jsonld.name: Cranberry Pork Tenderloins (Crock-Pot)
jsonld.author: Sassy in da South
jsonld.description: Very tasty, very simple to make crockpot pork tenderloins. I used orange juice when making mine since I love the combination of cranberry and orange. Onions, carrots and potatoes can be added to make a more complete meal. Cooking time varies on whether you cook on high or low temp.
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice or 3 tablespoons orange juice

recipeInstructions.text: Mix cranberry jelly, juice, mustard, and brown sugar together to form a sauce.
Place pork tenderloins in slow cooker and cover with sauce.
Cook on low for 8-10 hrs, or high 4-5 hours.

review.description: This is a really good and easy recipe for the slow cooker. I had 2 3/4 lb of pork tenderloin which I seasoned with salt & pepper and a turkey rub. I put sliced carrots, a parsnip and a small sliced onion on the bottom of crock then the pork (whole) on top. I mixed 1 can of whole canberry sauce, the orange juce and rest of ingredients on top and cooked for 1 hr on high and 6 hrs on low. It was so tender and delicious. Thank you for posting.
review.author: SmallTownGirl

ingredients.name: fresh lemon juice
ingredients.text: tablespoons fresh lemon juice or 3 tablespoons orange juice

jsonld.name: Cran-Raspberry Streusel Bars
jsonld.author: cookiedog
jsonld.description: Make and share this Cran-Raspberry Streusel Bars recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup butter, softened and cut into bits

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°.
Butter a 7- by 11-in. pan.
In a food processor, whirl flour, oats, and sugar 10 seconds.
Add 1 cup butter; whirl until mixture forms a ball.
Set aside 1/2 cup of mixture.
Whirl in yolks.
Press yolk mixture into pan.
Spread with preserves.
Sprinkle on cranberries, nuts, and chocolate chips, then press into dough.
Form pea-size crumbs with reserved dough mixture; sprinkle over top.
Bake at 350° until topping is pale gold, 45 minutes.
Cool on a rack; drizzle with melted white chocolate.
Cut into 24 bars.

review.description: Too much shortbread....could spread to a 9x13 pan...Need to fine seedless preserves.....otherwise great.
review.author: ynativities

ingredients.text: cup butter, softened and cut into bits

jsonld.name: Emerald City Salad
jsonld.author: Sharon123
jsonld.description: PCC is the local co-op in Seattle, Washington. They make this wonderful salad and I hope you will enjoy it too!

recipeInstructions.text: Bring 3 cups of water to a boil. Salt the water (if desired) and add rice. Bring back to a boil, cover, reduce heat to simmer and cook for 60 to 65 minutes. When the water is absorbed, remove from heat and let cool.
Meanwhile, make the dressing by whisking together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt and pepper. When the rice is cool, toss with dressing.
Remove tough stems and ribs from greens and chiffonade. Combine with peppers, fennel and green onion. Just before serving, toss veggies with dressed rice.

review.description: Very good salad which we enjoyed with grilled chicken! Made as directed but my amounts of the veggies may have differed slightly. Made for Zaar Tag! Thanks for sharing this keeper salad recipe!
review.author: ellie_

jsonld.name: Cranberry-Orange Bread
jsonld.author: Suzy Q 2
jsonld.description: I got this recipe off a bag of cranberrys. i always make this at christmas time, and i give them as gifts. if you use mini laof pans it yields 4 mini loaves

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350.
mix first 5 ingredients, then stir in next 4. when well blended add cranberrys and nuts.
bake for 55 minutes.
if making mini loaves they seem to have to bake for the same amount of time.

review.description: This is always a winner! We make this every year and people love it. Thanks for posting this.
review.author: nemokitty

jsonld.name: Cranberry Sorbet
jsonld.author: Sydney Mike
jsonld.description: This recipe was found in the 2001 As You Like It Cookbook. Preparation time does not include the time needed for the finished mixture to freeze.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups cranberries, thawed if frozen (fresh or frozen)

recipeInstructions.text: Place all the ingredients EXCEPT 2 cups of the orange juice in a blender & blend until smooth.
Transfer mixture to a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat & bring to a boil.
Remove from heat, add remaining 2 cups of orange juice & mix well.
Pour mixture into a flat plastic 2-quart container & place in the freezer.
When mixture is completely frozen, cut it with a sharp, sturdy knife into 1 1/2 inch cubes.
Place cubes in a food processor & process until completely pulverized, then serve immediately or place in a plastic container & return to the freezer until ready to use.

review.description: Delicious! I halved the recipe but otherwise, only changed the final two steps. Instead of waiting until completely frozen and then blending again, I used a fork to scrape through it a couple times during the freezing process. This probably affected the texture a little, making it more like a granita than a sorbet, but I didn't mind that so much. The taste was still excellent! Thanks Syd :) [Made for PAC Spring 2011]
review.author: flower7

ingredients.name: cranberry
ingredients.text: cups cranberries, thawed if frozen (fresh or frozen)

jsonld.name: Cool Cucumber and Black Bean Summer Salad
jsonld.author: The Easy Vegan
jsonld.description: A twist on the usual black bean and corn salad. Great in summer, but I love it year round! A nice, fresh, cooling salad for hot days. ^_^
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed

recipeInstructions.text: Make sure everything is drained well, mix everything in a bowl and serve! Great alone, as a salsa for chips, or on a taco salad!
(If you find your red onions garlic a little too spicy and hot, separately microwave them for 20-30~ seconds or longer depending on the strength of your microwave, and then add them.).

review.description: I made this as a salsa for a get-together. I changed the following: Two handfuls of cilantro, 1 and a half jalapenos, 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne pepper instead of 1/4. I also added half a large tomato since I had it hanging around from breakfast. Although I have now made this a spicy cucumber salad, it is still one of the best (and easiest) things I have made in a long time. Never would have thought black beans/cucumber/corn would go so well together. Love it!

itemReviewed.name: Cool Cucumber and Black Bean Summer Salad

review.author: Yin_of_Bartending

ingredients.text: (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed

jsonld.name: Creole Wedding Chicken
jsonld.author: Miss Annie
jsonld.description: I have no clue as to why this is "Wedding Chicken", but you will love it. The prep time is the marinate time.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse chicken thoroughly and pat dry.
Mix all above ingredients (EXCEPT: onions and oranges) and marinate chicken overnight.
Arrange the onions and orange slices on top of the chicken in a covered baking dish.
Pour marinade over chicken.
Cook for 45 minutes to 1 hour in a 350ºF oven or barbecue outside on the grill.

review.description: The marinade is wonderful, the chicken incredibly moist! I baked the chicken and was unable to eat with my family, but I warmed it up later and was a VERY content diner! Even warmed up it was very moist and we're talking chicken breast! I cannot wait to try this on the grill this summer. It's a no brainer to throw together (once I found creole mustard that is!) and cooking couldn't be easier either! Thanks Miss Annie for a terrific chicken dish!
review.author: Michelle S.

jsonld.name: Emeril's Favorite Potato Salad
jsonld.author: PACE6634
jsonld.description: Make and share this Emeril's Favorite Potato Salad recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 lbs red potatoes, such as red bliss

recipeInstructions.text: Place the potatoes in a medium saucepan and add enough water to cover by 1 inch. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until the potatoes are just tender, about 15 to 20 minutes. Drain, cool, then cut the potatoes into halves (or quarters if large).
In a large mixing bowl combine potatoes with all remaining ingredients and gently toss to combine. Refrigerate the salad several hours before serving to allow flavors to blend.

review.description: I don't eat mayo, and ordinarily potato salad is never on the menu at my BBQ's but this potato salad was DELICIOUS! My family really enjoyed it. I will definitely be making it again... Yay for a good, no mayo potato salad!
review.author: saintswife

ingredients.text: lbs red potatoes, such as red bliss

jsonld.name: Enchiladas for the Vegetarian
jsonld.author: Sydney Mike
jsonld.description: This is my vegetarian take on a great recipe -- recipe #191156 -- that was posted on Zaar by chef #324390!
jsonld.keywords: Black Beans,Berries,Beans,Fruit,Tex Mex,Southwestern U.S.,Low Cholesterol,Healthy,< 4 Hours
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) can whole berry cranberry sauce
2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed, drained
1/2 cup salsa (a thick salsa like Picante Mild Chunky Salsa)
1 (16 ounce) can whole berry cranberry sauce
2 cups salsa (a thick salsa like Picante Mild Chunky Salsa)

recipeInstructions.text: FOR THE FILLING: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F, then lightly coat a 13"x9" baking dish with cooking spray.
In a large bowl measure out all the filling ingredients & stir together until well blended, then set aside.
Stack the tortillas on a large plate, then spoon 3/4 to 1 cup of the filling onto each tortilla, just off center & about 1 inch from the top & bottom edges.
Roll up each tortilla around the filling, then place, seam side down in the prepared baking dish.
FOR THE SAUCE: In a bowl stir together the cranberry sauce & salsa, mixing well.
Spoon the sauce evenly over the filled tortillas, then cover with a sheet of aluminum foil.
FOR THE CHEESE TOPPING: Bake the enchiladas for 45 minutes, then remove the aluminum foil & sprinkle the shredded cheese over the top.
Return enchiladas to the oven & bake another 5 to 10 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.
These enchiladas are more easily served when cut in half.

review.description: Absolutely scrumptious! I used Paul Newman's Mango Tango salsa which added a bite as well as more sweetness; whatever salsa you choose will dominate the flavor since the recipe calls for so much. Each burrito is quite filling so this really does serve eight and I didn't miss the turkey at all. Something different!
review.author: FLKeysJen

ingredients.text: (16 ounce) can whole berry cranberry sauce
(15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed, drained
cup salsa (a thick salsa like Picante Mild Chunky Salsa)
(16 ounce) can whole berry cranberry sauce
cups salsa (a thick salsa like Picante Mild Chunky Salsa)

jsonld.name: Ellie Mae's Not-So-Irish Soda Bread
jsonld.author: Divaconviva
jsonld.description: The original recipe was on a Blue Bonnet Margarine box. I've modified it to suit my preferences, the main change being the addition of cardamom. Be sure your cardamom is fresh -- if you can't remember how long ago you got it, you won't get the wonderful fragrance and flavor that sets this bread apart. I took a loaf with a stick of butter to a St. Paddy's Party and people scarfed it down!
jsonld.keywords: Breads,Healthy,St. Patrick's Day,Brunch,< 60 Mins,For Large Groups
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 cups buttermilk or 1 1/2 cups sour milk

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
You'll need two 8-inch round greased cake pans.
Blend together in a large bowl flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, baking soda and cardamom.
Cut in butter or margarine until mixture resembles coarse meal. A pastry cutter works really well for this.
Add raisins, caraway seeds, milk and egg and stir until blended. Dough will be stiff.
Turn out dough from bowl and knead on floured board or counter for about one minute, until smooth.
Divide dough into two balls. I weigh the dough on my kitchen scale to get two loaves of equal weight/size.
Place in two greased 8-inch round cake pans. Flatten dough to fill pans. Cut a cross in top of each loaf.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes, or until inserted toothpick comes out clean.

review.description: Oh, this is such a wonderful bread. I had to contact the chef to ask how much it was supposed to rise, as mine did not puff up alot. But Chef Divaconviva said I did it right! This bread has a wonderfully tasty scone-like consistency, and the fragrance and taste of the cardamon makes it delicious. I will definitely be making this again. Very quick to put together and baked in 30 minutes. Delicious with breakfast or afternoon and evening tea. Loved it! Made for Fall 2008 PAC.
review.author: kitty.rock

ingredients.name: buttermilk
ingredients.text: cups buttermilk or 1 1/2 cups sour milk

jsonld.name: Erin Go Bragh Roast Sirloin
jsonld.author: Millereg
jsonld.description: Make and share this Erin Go Bragh Roast Sirloin recipe from Food.com.
jsonld.keywords: European,Very Low Carbs,Weeknight,St. Patrick's Day,Roast,Oven,< 4 Hours,Easy,Inexpensive
recipeIngredient: 10 fluid ounces red wine (NOT cooking wine)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat your oven to 350°F.
Wipe the meat, season to taste with salt and pepper and place in a roasting pan.
Place the pan in the oven and cook for one hour.
Add the whiskey and wine to the pan.
Cook for a further hour, basting once or twice.
Remove the roast from the pan, place on a serving dish and keep warm.
Pour off the excess fat from the meat juices, adding water to bring to about 15 fluid ounces.
Beat the butter into the flour to form a smooth paste.
Add a little of the juices to this and mix well, then pour onto the juices, mixing again, and bring to the boil.
Simmer gently for 2-3 minutes to cook the flour.
Correct the seasoning, if necessary.
If the sauce is too thick, add a little more water.
Serve separately in a gravy boat.
Serve with potatoes cooked in their jackets and a cooked green vegetable.

review.description: Good recipe; I'll try it again. I think I can make it come out better, as I used a dusty dry Italian red; something a little more fruity would have been better; likewise I didn't have any Irish Whiskey on hand, and used Canadian instead, doing it with Scotch or Irish would certainly improve my results. Mine cooked a little faster so had to pull it a little early. Likewise, when I next do this, I'm going to be a bit more fussy on the roast...this recipe has all sorts of potential to come up to a seriously great result, and my four stars reflects my mistakes, as opposed the author's...
review.author: John DOH

ingredients.name: red wine
ingredients.text: fluid ounces red wine (NOT cooking wine)

jsonld.name: Espresso Chocolate Mousse With Mascarpone Whipped Cream-Giada
jsonld.author: TaterBug
jsonld.description: This is a very easy to make but very, very rich and delicious dessert. I adapted this from Giada DeLaurentis. You must try it!

recipeInstructions.text: For the mousse:
In a small saucepan over medium heat, stir milk and sugar together and add the espresso powder, cook until the milk is hot but not boiling. Place the chocolate chips in blender.
Pour the hot milk over the chips. Run the blender on high until well combined, a few seconds. Add the egg whites and run the blender on high until light, about 1 minute.
Transfer the mousse to 4 small serving cups.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until firm or about 3 hours.
For the cream:.
Hold off on making the cream until the mousse is set so that you can add it on at the last minute before serving. Or store it in the fridge.
Mix the cream, marscarpone,vanilla and powdered sugar and whip together with a mixer until light and fluffy.

review.description: This was phenomenal and couldn't have been any easier to make. Ridiculously easy. I cut the richness by throwing some raspberries on top.

itemReviewed.name: Espresso Chocolate Mousse With Mascarpone Whipped Cream-Giada

review.author: tomato_77

jsonld.name: English Toffee
jsonld.author: McMoose
jsonld.description: I've been making this for holiday gifts for 30 years. No one ever seems to get tired of receiving it! Always a big hit and I'm constanly being asked for the recipe.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in large saucepan.
Add sugar.

Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture reaches 310 degrees on a candy thermometer. This usually take 20-30 minutes of constant stirring to prevent burning. Will go through several stages as it cooks. When it turns the color of brown sugar it is getting close to being done. Caution: Can burn easily as it nears the end, so keep stirring!
Pour onto 2 greased cookie sheets. (I use the butter left on the wrappers).
Alow to cool slightly so that surface is firm but still hot. Pour a quarter of the chocolate chips onto each piece and spread to cover once they have melted.
Sprinkle with nuts and press into chocolate so they don't all fall off.
Allow to cool and then flip over.
Melt remaining chocolate chips in microwave and spread on second side.
Sprinkle with more nuts.
Place in fridge to cool completely.
Break into pieces and store in covered container in fridge.

review.description: My mom shared this recipe with me when I was young and just started cooking. It tastes like a Heath candy bar. It does take some time to cook. The first stage is that the butter and sugar will mix together. Then as it cooks the two will separate. Just keep stiring! The two will then blend together again. Shortly after this stage happens you only have to stir a little longer and it should be a nice brown sugar color. I only put chocolate on one side and only use one cookie sheet so it's a little thicker. Yum!
review.author: mrsmeduck

jsonld.name: English Cobblestone Bread
jsonld.author: Marjie501
jsonld.description:
A fine-textured white bread made in your bread machine. It is most excellent toasted or in sandwiches. Makes perfect BLT's. Makes a 1 1/2 pound loaf.
Tip: I use Fleischmann's Instant Yeast. It comes in 1 pound bags. Very reasonably priced and has never failed for me. Keep it in the freezer or fridge.
recipeIngredient: 3 cups bread flour (can substitute part wheat flour)

recipeInstructions.text: Follow directions for your bread machine.
I take my bread out of the machine before the final rise, put it in a greased bread pan let it rise, and bake it at 350 degrees for 22 to 26 minutes or until browned.

review.description: Wonderful bread. This may be my goto recipe for our weekly bread. DH loves BLT's and this is great for any sandwich.
review.author: adopt a greyhound

ingredients.text: cups bread flour (can substitute part wheat flour)

jsonld.name: Family-Size Veggie Calzone
jsonld.author: zoe85
jsonld.description: Make and share this Family-Size Veggie Calzone recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 2 (13 7/8 ounce) cans refrigerated prepared pizza crust
2 (8 ounce) packages kraft shredded mozzarella cheese
1 1/2 cups chopped assorted fresh vegetables (broccoli, carrots and green peppers)
1/2 cup kraft 100% grated parmesan cheese, divided

recipeInstructions.text: PREHEAT oven to 375°F Unroll 1 of the pizza crusts onto baking sheet. Gently pat out crust to 12x10-inch rectangle; spread evenly with the pizza sauce to within 1 inch of edges of crust.

SPRINKLE with half of the mozzarella cheese, the vegetables and remaining mozzarella cheese. Reserve 1 tablespoons of the Parmesan cheese; sprinkle remaining Parmesan cheese over mozzarella cheese. Top with second pizza crust; crimp edges with fork to seal. Sprinkle with the reserved Parmesan cheese.
BAKE 25 to 30 minute or until golden brown. Let stand 5 minute before cutting into 8 pieces to serve.

review.description: Wow! I am pleased to be the first one to write a review on this recipe! First of all, I chose it because it feeds more than one, and all the ingredients were at my local store and it was easier than making my own dough. We are vacationing at my Moms little house which only has a tiny mini kitchen with a very small oven, so a 10" x 12" pan just happened to be the largest she had. I had to roll out the dough and cut about 4" off that wouldnt fit into the pan, and next time in our oven, I will use a 11" x 14" cookie sheet and just make it bigger! I used way less cheese, (less than one 8oz package), bought Ragu Pizza sauce (and reserved the unused portion for dipping) and made the filling Pineapple, Onion, Green Onion, and Olive. Wow again, just writeing about it the next morning makes me want to heat up the leftovers for breakfast! :) It came out lovely, and the super picky vegetarian boyfriend almost got third helpings! 375 and 25 mins for us. Thanks a bunch!! Oh, made recipe #150490 as a side dish (broccoli sauteed with olive oil, garlic, white wine, red pepper flakes, and lemon zest- wow too!)
review.author: RobynLUVs2Cook

ingredients.name: pizza crust
ingredients.text: (13 7/8 ounce) cans refrigerated prepared pizza crust

ingredients.name: mozzarella
ingredients.text: (8 ounce) packages kraft shredded mozzarella cheese

ingredients.name: assorted fresh vegetable
ingredients.text: cups chopped assorted fresh vegetables (broccoli, carrots and green peppers)

ingredients.name: parmesan cheese
ingredients.text: cup kraft 100% grated parmesan cheese, divided

jsonld.name: Everyone Loves It Meatloaf
jsonld.author: Chef Lizzie
jsonld.description: I modified a recipe from Emeril's book "There's a Chef in my Kitchen" on a night when I had little time and less ingredients. The family loved it, so I thought I would share.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix all ingredients for the meatloaf together, and press into an 8x8 baking pan.
Mix together the glaze ingredients, and spread over the top of the meatloaf. Bake for 1 hour at 375 degrees.

review.description: Oh, my, I can see why everyone loves this! So very good. I halved the recipe as it's just DH, me, and 2 very small toddlers. Baking time for this was around 35-40 minutes. I loved that it was in an 8x8 pan too, it made serving so much easier than trying to dig out of a loaf pan! Made for PAC Spring '11.
review.author: RSL5709

jsonld.name: Etta's Crab Cakes (Tom Douglas)
jsonld.author: BarbryT
jsonld.description:
Living in Seattle, and having eaten these at Etta's, I can attest that Etta's Crab Cakes are superb. They are included in "I Love Crab Cakes: 50 Recipes for an American Classic" by Tom Douglas with Shelley Lance and have been "rereleased" (so to speak) on numerous other websites.

One hour of the estimated preparation time is chilling time.

Timing is based on buying (admittedly pricey)Dungeness crab meat. If buying cooked crabs and planning to extract crab meat yourself, add at least an hour.
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon finely chopped red bell pepper
1 lb fresh dungeness crabmeat, picked clean of shell and lightly squeezed if wet

recipeInstructions.text: In a small food processor, combine egg yolk, vinegar, mustard, bell pepper, onion, parsley, Tabasco, paprika, thyme, salt and pepper.
Pulse to mince the vegetables and combine the ingredients.
With motor running, slowly add oil through the feed tube until the mixture emulsifies and forms a thin mayonnaise.
Transfer mayonnaise mixture to a large bowl and stir in sour cream, then carefully fold in crabmeat.
Gently form into 8 crabcakes, about 3 inches across and ¾-inch thick.
Put the fresh bread crumbs in a shallow container and stir in parsley.
Lightly dredge the crab cakes on both sides in the bread crumbs.
Chill for at least 1 hour (preferably longer).
Put 2 large nonstick skillets over medium heat and add about 2 tablespoons butter to each pan. When butter is melted, add 4 cakes to each pan.
Gently fry until golden brown on both sides and hot through, turning once with a spatula, about 4 minutes on each side.
Depending on appetites, suggest service of two crab cakes per serving, with lemon wedges.

review.description: This recipe made two hours of picking crabs (blue crabs from the Connecticut River) completely worth every minute, Heavenly bites!!! In reading through the recipe I was surprised to see that no breadcrumbs are mixed in with the crab before forming the crabcakes. I compared this recipe with another Tom Douglas recipe where he mixes in 1 cup of the crumb mixture. Possibly a typo? In any case, folding in one cup of the crumb mixture meant the cakes hold together, no problem. Our new favorite recipe for crabcakes
review.author: Seniah

ingredients.text: tablespoon finely chopped red bell pepper
lb fresh dungeness crabmeat, picked clean of shell and lightly squeezed if wet

jsonld.name: Fast and Easy Pudding
jsonld.author: Boomette
jsonld.description: This pudding doesn't have eggs. It has a butterscotch sauce. I made it a few years ago. For me that's a 4 star. The recipe is from Jean Paré.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the first 6 ingredients in a bowl. Stir. Add milk. Stir. Pour in a baking dish of 2 L (2 pints). Level the top.
In the same bowl, combine the 4 other ingredients (water to brown sugar). Stir. Pour slowly on the dough, in the baking dish. DON'T STIR.
Cook in the oven at 350 F, uncovered, for about 30 minutes. Serve warm.

review.description: I must have done something wrong because unfortunately this just did not work for me. I made it once and it was so wattery. So I tried again and kept it in the oven longer and still had no luck. It was like a floating dough kind of. My boyfriend tried a spoonful and said it still tasted ok so that is why I gave it two stars. I'm sorry this didn't work for me!
review.author: KellyMac6

jsonld.name: Fantastic Grilled Beef Kabobs!
jsonld.author: Kittencalrecipezazz
jsonld.description: My family *loves* these kabobs, plan ahead the beef needs to marinate 8 hours or overnight is even better, if you are using wooden skewers make certain to soak them in cold water for a minimum of 30 minutes before using them for grilling or they will burn, this recipe serves 3-4 people (two skewers each) but I would suggest to double the recipe if you are serving more than 4 people --- cooking time is only estimated and prep time includes marinating time. The French dressing can be replaced with Russian dressing if desired, you will love these! :)
recipeIngredient: 1 lb boneless beef top sirloin steak, cut into 1-1/2-inch squares (should have about 8-10 pieces)
2 -3 cloves finely minced fresh garlic or 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
1 large green bell pepper, cut into larger-size chunks
1 large red bell pepper, cut into larger-size chunks

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, combine salad dressing, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, pepper and fresh minced garlic or garlic powder (if using) mix well to combine; reserve about 1/4 cup and refrigerate.
Using a shallow glass dish place in the beef cubes, and pour the remaining marinade over the beef; toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight is even better.
After 8 hours, remove the beef, and discard the marinade.
Wrap the bacon slices around the beef cubes.
Then thread the beef alternately with the coarsely chopped veggies (make certain to thread the skewers through the wrapped bacon side, or the bacon will come open when grilled).
Grill over hot heat for about 10-15 minutes, basting frequently with reserved marinade, or until beef reaches desired tenderness.

review.description: Very easy and delicious!
review.author: Cathee B.

ingredients.name: beef top sirloin steak
ingredients.text: lb boneless beef top sirloin steak, cut into 1-1/2-inch squares (should have about 8-10 pieces)

ingredients.name: fresh garlic
ingredients.text: cloves finely minced fresh garlic or 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder

ingredients.name: green bell pepper
ingredients.text: large green bell pepper, cut into larger-size chunks

ingredients.name: red bell pepper
ingredients.text: large red bell pepper, cut into larger-size chunks

jsonld.name: Fast, Delicious and Easy Broiled Ham Dinner
jsonld.author: Pianolady
jsonld.description: This is so quick and easy -- and has been enjoyed by all of us many times over the years. When my son was growing up I used it for many a "last minute" dinner when time got away from us. It can be made with leftover ham, or from time to time I buy a package of sliced, pre-cooked ham in the deli section of the supermarket.
recipeIngredient: 4 slices of pre-cooked ham, about 3/4 &quot,thick slices

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together the first five ingredients (everything except the ham).
Slash the fat edge of the ham, if present.
Place ham on the rack in a broiler pan.
Spread 1/2 of the apricot glaze on the ham.
Broil 3" from heat for 6 minutes.
Turn ham and spread with remaining glaze.
Broil 6 minutes more.
Serve.
Enjoy!

review.description: I don't like ham.......but my DH does. He bought a ham slice, so I knew I'd have to cook it. I made this recipe as directed, except I didn't add the salt....to my surprise......DELICIOUS! Cooking time is spot on. I will use this recipe again! Thanks!

itemReviewed.name: Fast, Delicious and Easy Broiled Ham Dinner

review.author: llangrove

ingredients.name: ham
ingredients.text: slices of pre-cooked ham, about 3/4 &quot,thick slices

jsonld.name: Farfalle With Chicken, Ricotta, Spinach, and Plum Tomatoes
jsonld.author: Brookelynne26
jsonld.description: Make and share this Farfalle With Chicken, Ricotta, Spinach, and Plum Tomatoes recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup whole canned tomatoes, drained and crushed

recipeInstructions.text: Cook pasta according to package directions.
While pasta is cooking, heat the oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Add the garlic and shallot and saute for 2 minutes. Add the chicken, wine, and tomatoes. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the drained cooked pasta, spinach, ricotta, and cream. Season with salt and pepper and garnish with Parmesan.

review.description: I really liked this, and I loved the sauce...but I wanted more chicken! I was wary about the canned tomatoes, but they were still delicious along with the rest of the dish.

itemReviewed.name: Farfalle With Chicken, Ricotta, Spinach, and Plum Tomatoes

review.author: Abbs lt3

ingredients.text: cup whole canned tomatoes, drained and crushed

jsonld.name: Fancy Shmancy Baked Chard Stuffed Onions
jsonld.author: I Cook Therefore I
jsonld.description: Adapted from a cookbook called Flavoring with Herbs, this is a great recipe for stuffed onions, but ONLY if you really like onions. The presentation of them is amazing, and they can be used as a side dish to any main course, or as a vegetarian main dish (that's what we do!)
recipeIngredient: 12 ounces swiss chard, steamed, squeezed dry, chopped
3 ounces pine nuts, toasted and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Place unpeeled onions in a pan, cover with water and boil for ten minutes or until tender, remove from water and cool.
Trim off the root of the onion and save, peel off the outer skin of the onion.
Using a spoon, hallow out the center of the onion so that there are only two outter layers left.
Chop the insides of the onions and reserve.
Over medium heat, heat the butter and cook the sage, chard, and garlic.
Remove from heat and mix with the chopped onions and the pine nuts.
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
For Sauce: heat the butter over medium heat and gradually stir in flour until it is absorbed.
Gradually add the milk a little at a time, bring to a boil and then lower heat to simmer until the sauce thickens.
Add the Parmesan to the sauce, and then mix it in with the chard mix.
Stuff the onion cases with the herb and sauce mix.
Arrange onions in a greased 9X13" oven safe baking dish and add the vegetable stock and any of the left over stuffing to the dish around the onions.
Top the onions with the reserved root "caps" and heat in the oven for 20 minutes, or until heated through.
Upon serving, spoon the vegetable broth mixture over the onions.
Enjoy!

review.description: Even enjoyed by one of my friends who has always stated a loathing for swiss chard / spinach (LOL) - so a great option for all out there trying to get some of the healthy, but "dreaded greens" into their loved-ones' diets. Re personal preference I omitted the pine nuts. I also tried stuffing some tomatoes with the mixture - they were lovely too. Thank you.

itemReviewed.name: Fancy Shmancy Baked Chard Stuffed Onions

review.author: Shazzie

ingredients.text: ounces swiss chard, steamed, squeezed dry, chopped
ounces pine nuts, toasted and chopped

jsonld.name: Fake Steak
jsonld.author: Sharon123
jsonld.description: Make and share this Fake Steak recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup Braggs liquid aminos or 1 cup soy sauce

recipeInstructions.text: For Broth:
Combine all ingredients in a large stock pot. Bring to a boil and let simmer 15 minutes prior to adding steaks.
For Steaks:

In a blender, combine first six ingredients. Process approximately 1 - 2 minutes - until smooth. Pour into mixing bowl. Using the dough hook, add gluten flour and process 3 - 4 minutes until smooth and forms into a rubbery ball. Remove dough and divide into two parts. Shape each part into a log shape approximately two inches around. Slice each log into 1/4 inch slices. Drop steak slices into boiling broth. When all steak slices are in the broth, turn heat down to a slow simmer and cook approximately 1 - 2 hours. Steak pieces will almost double in size and become lighter in color. Remove from broth and use in any recipe asking for gluten steaks or grind steaks and use in place of burger. Enjoy!

Brenda Walsh, one of the sisters, says she likes to use this recipe for so many things, such as placing the steaks on a baking sheet sprayed with non-stick cooking spray and baking for 30 minutes. This changes the texture to a slightly more “chewy” consistency. Then placing them in a baking dish and pouring mushroom soup over them and baking for 1 hour. Delicious and easy! She also likes to make “steak” sandwiches with them. Try frying these with onions, placing them in a baking dish, pouring canned tomatoes over them and baking for one hour.

review.description: Delicious! (and I even made a mistake)! I cut the recipe in half, but accidently used the full amount of rolled oats :( These still turned out great. I used Bragg's for the broth, and simmered them in the broth for about an hour and 45 minutes. Tehn for dinner, I stir fried the strips with some green peppers, adobo seasoning and chipotle and made fajitas! So much less expensive than packaged seitan in the store, or Morning Star "steak" strips
review.author: Kozmic Blues

ingredients.text: cup Braggs liquid aminos or 1 cup soy sauce

jsonld.name: Fabulous Sue's Coconut Bars
jsonld.author: WiGal
jsonld.description: This comes from my sister who also loves to cook. If you like coconut and are looking for something easy to put together, you will love this! A little goes a long ways b/c this is more like a candy.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Melt margarine in a 9 X 13 inch pan.
Remove pan from oven.
Sprinkle crumbs in pan and press down with a fork.
Sprinkle coconut over the crumbs.
Add the nuts and marshmallows.
Drizzle the sweetened condensed milk over all.
Bake for 25-30 minutes.
Cool.
Melt both kinds of chocolate chips in the microwave; spread over your bars; and cool.

review.description: Very good but cut into tiny squares as this is one rich bar! Thanks for posting!
review.author: pammyowl

jsonld.name: Fats Waller Hot and Sassy Cornbread
jsonld.author: Sharon123
jsonld.description: Fats Waller was an American jazz pianist, organist, composer and comedic entertainer. Many songs he wrote or co-wrote are still popular, such as "Honeysuckle Rose", "Ain't Misbehavin'" and "Squeeze Me". 'He was known as the soul of melody....a man who made the piano sing...both big in body and in mind...known for his generosity...a bubbling bundle of joy'. Well, if he were still around, he'd write a song about this cornbread! Adpapted from The New Basics Cookbook.
recipeIngredient: fresh ground black pepper, to taste
1/2 cup corn kernel, fresh (or frozen, thawed if frozen)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400*F.
Butter an 8" square baking pan.
Toss the dry ingredients together in a mixing bowl.
In another bowl, stir the cream style corn and all the rest of the ingredients together until smooth.
Add half the liquid mixture to the dry mixture, stirring just until blended. Add the remaining liquid and again stir until just blended. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan.
Bake at 400*F. until the top is golden and a toothpick or knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Cool slightly in the pan before cutting into squares. Enjoy!
Note:.
For a dark, crisp crust, bake the batter in a preheated, greased cast iron skillet. Serve fresh and hot with sweet butter and honey!

review.description: This is definately cornbread worth singing about! I picked up some blue organic cornmeal to make this with, and baked it in a cast iron pan, as recommended. I stuck to one jalapeno today, and it added the perfect zip! I loved the colours in this, the blue, yellow, and green. Thanks, Sharon! Made for our wonderful VIP in Veggie Swap #20!

itemReviewed.name: Fats Waller Hot and Sassy Cornbread

review.author: Katzen

ingredients.name: fresh ground black pepper
ingredients.text: fresh ground black pepper, to taste

ingredients.name: corn kernel
ingredients.text: cup corn kernel, fresh (or frozen, thawed if frozen)

jsonld.name: Farmhouse Caramel Dumpling Pudding
jsonld.author: Debber
jsonld.description: An old-fashioned oven-baked dessert that does all the work (well, most of it!). Check out the variations listed and try something new each time!

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350; grease a 2-quart baking dish; set aside.
In a small saucepan over medium heat, bring water and brown sugar to a boil; remove from heat; stir in butter & vanilla until butter is melted; pour into prepared pan; set aside.
In a bowl, combine dry ingredients, and milk just until blended, then brown sugar.
Fold in raisins and nuts; drop by spoon-ful over top of the sauce.
Bake uncovered for 30 minutes (bubbly & golden brown).
Spoon into serving dishes, top with whipped or ice cream.
VARIATIONS: try subbing the raisins with snippets of dried apricots or cranberries.
Use any combination of your favorite nuts: walnuts, pecans, cashews--yum!

review.description: Gorgeous and addictive !! This is such an easy pud for a winter's night - i used light butter and light evaporated milk and served it with light cream . Made for ZWT4 - thanks for posting something so yummy, Debber.
review.author: katew

jsonld.name: Elegant Vegetable Casserole
jsonld.author: Shelby Jo
jsonld.description: From Taste of Home's Healthy Cooking Magazine. This casserole looks so great! A nice presentation for the holiday table.
recipeIngredient: 2 lbs potatoes, peeled and cubed (about 4 medium)
1 medium butternut squash, peeled and cubed (about 3 pounds)
2 (10 ounce) packages frozen chopped spinach, thawed and sqeezed dry

recipeInstructions.text: Place potatoes and parsnips in a large saucepan. Cover with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Mash with sour cream, milk and salt. Set aside.
Place squash in another large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until tender. Drain, mash with salt and nutmeg and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk the eggs, millk, and salt. Stir in the spinach, cheese, bread crumbs, and onion.

Place half of the parsnip potatoes at one end of a 13 x 9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Add squash to the dish forming a stripe next to the parsnip potatoes. Repeat with spinach. Place remaining parsnip otatoes at the opposite end of the dish. (Dish will be full).
Cover and bake at 350 for 45-55 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted in the middle reads 160 degrees.

review.description:
Wow this is great.
I have made it twice, the first time as directed. The second time I made these changes
I did not add the milk to the Parsnip and potato, but add 1 beaten egg.
I roasted the Squash as I found it to be a little water the first time. and I only used 1/2 cup bread crumbs in the Spinach. 
I layered in starting with the parsnip mixture then the squash and then last the Spinach and then baked.
I made it the day before and when it was cold cut it into square and re heated on a cookie sheet. It was great and I'll be making it for 40 people for the Christmas Buffet. Thanks
review.author: Laureen in B.C.

ingredients.text: lbs potatoes, peeled and cubed (about 4 medium)
medium butternut squash, peeled and cubed (about 3 pounds)
(10 ounce) packages frozen chopped spinach, thawed and sqeezed dry

jsonld.name: Favorite Corn Muffins
jsonld.author: MizzNezz
jsonld.description: Make and share this Favorite Corn Muffins recipe from Food.com.

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl, combine first 5 ingredients.
Add milk, eggs, and oil.
Beat for 1 minute.
Pour into greased (or paper lined) muffin tins.
Bake at 400* for 20-25 minutes.

review.description: I thought these were great! I can't get Jiffy mix here in Germany and we love it. So this was a nice "substitute". Not quite as sweet as Jiffy, but very yummy & moist. Thanks!
review.author: momofpjc

jsonld.name: Fawn Pie
jsonld.author: Peggy Lynn
jsonld.description: This was just printed in today's food section--The Houston Chronicle--hope you enjoy this tasty pie!
recipeIngredient: 1 (9 inch) pie shells, prebaked (according to manufacturer's instructions)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large saucepan, combine all ingredients except pie shell.
Cook over medium heat until filling is thick.
Pour into pie crust, and bake about twenty minutes at 350° until firm.

review.description: This pie was good...something different. Pretty easy to make. I like coconut and I had several cans of pineapple in the pantry. DH thought it was pretty good too and he only slightly likes coconut. Thanks for introducing us to a new kind of pie!
review.author: StacyMD187373

ingredients.text: (9 inch) pie shells, prebaked (according to manufacturer's instructions)

jsonld.name: Feta Artichoke Dip
jsonld.author: DrGaellon
jsonld.description: Adapted from a recipe by ad6faith on allrecipes.com. Be sure the artichokes and pimentos are drained really well to keep the dip from being watery. Perfect for parties or holiday dinners. Serve with baguette slices, ciabatta bread, crackers, or veggies (it's a little too thick for the average potato chip).
recipeIngredient: 1 (13 3/4 ounce) can artichoke hearts, rinsed, drained well and coarsely chopped
2 ounces pimientos, rinsed, drained well and diced

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350F (175C). Lightly grease 9x9 inch baking dish.
Combine the artichoke hearts, feta, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, pimientos, and garlic in a bowl; blend thoroughly. Spoon into prepared baking dish.
Bake in preheated oven until top is bubbly and lightly browned, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove and garnish with tomatoes and green onions.

review.description: This is absolutely delicious! I forgot the onion as a garnish and didn't have any pimientos, but it was still wonderful!
review.author: iris5555

ingredients.text: (13 3/4 ounce) can artichoke hearts, rinsed, drained well and coarsely chopped

ingredients.text: ounces pimientos, rinsed, drained well and diced

jsonld.name: Extreme Apple Cake
jsonld.author: Country Girl 2
jsonld.description: This is by far the best cake, one of my faves. and it's so easy. You can top it with cream cheese or cool whip, or serve it with a scoop of ice cream, but I prefer it by it's self. FYI the longer the cake sits the better it is.
recipeIngredient: 4 cups chopped apples (usually about 6 Granny Smiths)
1 cup sugar (may want to add more depending on what kind of apple using)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350. Mix all the dry ingrediants together, stir in eggs and oil. Then stir in apples and pecans. Mixture will be extremely thick.
Pour in a floured/greased 13x9 pan.
Bake for 45 - 55 minutes.

review.description: This has become my new go-to recipe for apples.....<br/><br/>We picked 200 pounds from a friend's tree, and I wanted a recipe that would use a lot of apples.... so I searched the internet for "extreme apple cake." This is the first entry that popped up, and I have now made 6 batches. The cake is moist, filled with apple pieces, and really tasty.<br/><br/>The things I changed a bit were adding 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp of cloves, 1/4 tsp of nutmeg, topping with sparkling sugar, and baking it several minutes longer. I found that having it be a little browner let the crust caramelize, and gave it a wonderful flavor.<br/><br/>I made the recipe into a 9x13 pan, then 2 loaf pans, then cupcakes. All have been wonderful. The cake keeps really well too, so it is great for gifts!<br/><br/>THANKS for the wonderful recipe!
review.author: erinsparin

ingredients.text: cups chopped apples (usually about 6 Granny Smiths)
cup sugar (may want to add more depending on what kind of apple using)

jsonld.name: Feta-Asparagus
jsonld.author: MizzNezz
jsonld.description: Make and share this Feta-Asparagus recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1 medium red onion, sliced and separated into rings

recipeInstructions.text: Place asparagus in 1/2 inch water in lg skillet.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
In small skillet, saute onion in oil until crisp-tender.
Place asparagus on plate.
Top with onions and feta.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

review.description: It's that time of year again for enjoying fresh asparagus! I'm so glad I started with this recipe! This was so delicious and very easy to prepare! It looked so nice on the table I couldn't wait to eat! the feta and red onion make nice additions to the great dish! Thanks for sharing, Nez!
review.author: Bev I Am

ingredients.name: red onion
ingredients.text: medium red onion, sliced and separated into rings

jsonld.name: Fettuccine With Creamy Tomato and Sausage Sauce
jsonld.author: Dona England
jsonld.description:
From Epicurious.com
A Salad, some crusty bread and wine are all that's needed with this hearty pasta dish.
recipeIngredient: 1 lb sweet Italian sausage, casings removed
2 (14 1/2 ounce) cans Italian-style diced tomatoes, in juice

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add shallots and garlic and sauté until beginning to soften, about 3 minutes. Add sausages and sauté until no longer pink, breaking up with back of fork, about 5 minutes. Add cream; simmer 5 minutes. Add tomatoes with juices, sage and crushed red pepper. Simmer until sauce thickens, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook pasta in large pot of boiling salted water until just tender but still firm to bite. Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup cooking liquid.

Return pasta to same pot; add sauce. Toss over medium heat until sauce coats pasta, adding reserved cooking liquid by 1/4 cupfuls if mixture is dry. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to bowl; sprinkle with cheese and serve.

review.description: Very good and quick. I will make this again. However, I reduced the amount of pasta to a little over 1/2 pound. I only had chicken sausage and evaporated milk but the result was still delicious.

itemReviewed.name: Fettuccine With Creamy Tomato and Sausage Sauce

review.author: Nado2003

jsonld.name: Emirati Yellow Rice
jsonld.author: UmmBinat
jsonld.description: Use Recipe #418911 for the chicken stock to be authentic. It includes turmeric to make the rice yellow. Modified from http://emiraticankitchen.wordpress.com.
jsonld.keywords: Long Grain Rice,Rice,Southwest Asia (middle East),Asian,Lactose Free,Low Cholesterol,Egg Free,Healthy,Free Of...,Ramadan,Savory,Weeknight,< 4 Hours,Easy
recipeIngredient: 4 -5 cups chicken stock, with a little water added if need be (Please use Emirati Style Yellow Chicken Stock to be authentic It includes turmeric to make the rice yellow)

recipeInstructions.text: Gently wash the rice in three changes of water. Let the rice soak in water for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 250°F.
Put stock into a large pot with saffron.
Bring to a boil.
Drain the rice and add to the boiling stock. Stir once or twice very gently.
Let boil for 8 minutes and strain the rice.
Put rice in a greased pan and cover with aluminum foil and place in the oven 30 minutes or until ready to eat up to 1 hour 1/2.
You may use the remaining stock in Recipe #388925.

review.description: Delicious way to make rice! I used recipe #418911 for the stock, which gives the rice this extraordinary flavour. Thanks for sharing!<br/>Made for Exploring UAE in the N*A*M*E Forum.
review.author: Mia in Germany

ingredients.name: chicken stock
ingredients.text: cups chicken stock, with a little water added if need be (Please use Emirati Style Yellow Chicken Stock to be authentic It includes turmeric to make the rice yellow)

jsonld.name: Fifth Avenue Grill Blue Cheese Coleslaw
jsonld.author: reniwick
jsonld.description: This recipe was posted on 4-26-07 by the Sun-Sentinel. This recipe is made at the Fifth Avenue Grill, 4650 N. Federal Highway, Lighthouse Point, FL and I hear that it is the best. They recommend shredding your own vegetables for the best and freshest results. The addition of a good crumbled blue cheese and the use of Marzetti Original Slaw Dressing help to make this "the best" according to the Sun-Sentinel.
recipeIngredient: 8 scallions, white part and 1-inch of green, thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, toss all the ingredients gently but thoroughly together until well coated with the dressing.
Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving to allow the ingredients to meld.
Toss again before serving and serve well chilled.

review.description: Very simple but tasty!

itemReviewed.name: Fifth Avenue Grill Blue Cheese Coleslaw

jsonld.name: Fiesta Chicken Casserole
jsonld.author: sweetcakes
jsonld.description: Make and share this Fiesta Chicken Casserole recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 10 3/4 ounces condensed cream of chicken soup
9 ounces frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 375*. Lightly grease 2 quart casserole.
In a large bowl combine sour cream, 1/3 cup milk, onion, garlic salt, cumin, hot pepper sauce, soup, spinach, chilies and pimento. Blend well.
In another bowl combine chicken and cheese, toss lightly.
Spoon half spinach mixture into casserole, sprinkle with half chicken mixture. Repeat layers.
Beat egg whites to soft peak. Set aside.
Combine flour, baking powder, 3/4 cup milk, butter and egg yolks. Beat at low speed until moistened, beat 4 minutes at high speed.
Fold in egg whites. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle with paprika.
Bake for 40 to 45 minutes.

review.description: I used to make this in the 1990's and early 2000's, but I lost the recipe along the way. My husband has been asking me for at least 10 years to make it and I'm so glad I've found it again. I will be making this very soon!
review.author: Teresa P.

ingredients.text: 3/4 ounces condensed cream of chicken soup
ounces frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

jsonld.name: Firefly Juice (Punch)
jsonld.author: Jennibear
jsonld.description: One of the best days that my son had in Kindergarden was the day his teacher made Firefly Juice! My picky 5 year old had his teacher write out the recipe and brought the delicious mixture home from school. This recipe is for a large batch, but we also can make a glass at a time just using smaller amounts. We love it! It's really is good! Cute name. Easy. Fun. Enjoy!
jsonld.keywords: Beverages,Toddler Friendly,Kid Friendly,Brunch,< 15 Mins,For Large Groups,Easy
recipeIngredient: 1 (2 liter) bottle Sprite (or 7-Up, Sierra Mist, etc.)
1 (7 ounce) can whipped cream, spray can (RediWhip)

recipeInstructions.text: Mix equal parts of pineapple-orange juice and Sprite and stir gently. Top of a spritz of whipped cream and sprinkles. A straw is helpful. Enjoy your firefly juice!

review.description: My kids got a kick out of this punch! They thought it was so cool to have a drink with whipped cream and sprinkles! They thought it tasted great, too. I enjoyed it myself! This will be a fun treat for us all! Made for PAC Fall 2009

jsonld.name: Fabulous Apple Pie Cake
jsonld.author: Gingerbear
jsonld.description: Make and share this Fabulous Apple Pie Cake recipe from Food.com.

recipeInstructions.text: Thoroughly grease a 9-inch pie pan.
Melt margarine, remove from heat and blend with sugar and egg.
Mix in flour, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg, cloves, vanilla, apples and pecans.
Spread into pan.
Bake in a preheated 350° oven for 40 to 45 minutes.
Serve warm with ice cream.

review.description: Very easy and very tasty. Did not use pecans, nutmeg and cloves and only used egg whites, but it still came out great! Thanks for posting.
review.author: TSAKI

jsonld.name: Exotic and Sweet Moroccan Chicken with Spicy Rice
jsonld.author: Mirj2338
jsonld.description: Make and share this Exotic and Sweet Moroccan Chicken with Spicy Rice recipe from Food.com.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon (add more if feeling adventurous)
1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh chili pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the chicken breast into largish bite-sized portions.
Mix the flour with the cinnamon, confectioner's sugar, ginger, salt and pepper to taste.
Dredge the chicken pieces in the flour mixture.
Fry in shallow oil until browned and cooked through, turning once.
Keep warm in a low oven.
Saute the chile peppers, mushrooms and onion in oil until softened and golden.
Add the cooked basmati rice and continue sauteing until cooked through.
Add the salt and pepper to taste.
Spread the rice and a large platter.
Top with a pyramid of chicken pieces.
Garnish with fresh cilantro (coriander), if desired.

review.description:
I tried this recipe yesterday. I'm sorry but the cinnamon and powdered sugar didn't do it for me.
I prefer cumin and lemons in the Morroccan recipes and the powdered sugar was too sweet.

itemReviewed.name: Exotic and Sweet Moroccan Chicken with Spicy Rice
